original: @1b # // de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa'i rtog pa bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po brnyes pa dang / 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba bla na med pa mdzad par bstan nas /
analyzed: @1b # // de ltar ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis theg pa chen po mngon par rtogs pa'i rtog pa bla na med pa'i chos kyi rgyal po brnyes pa dang / 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba bla na med pa mdzad par bstan nas /
translated: As such, having taught the attainment of the unsurpassed Dharma King, the conception of the realization of the Mahāyāna, and the performance of the unsurpassed victory over the three worlds,

original: rnam par rgyal ba rnams kyi gnas rnam par dgod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal ba rnams kyi gnas rnam par dgod pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the arrangement of the abode of victory,

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the Bhagavān said, “Then,” and so on.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
translated: “ Then” is the occasion.

original: rnam par rgyal bar mdzad pa'i sa gsum gyi skye bo rnam par gzhag pa'i nang na /
analyzed: rnam par rgyal bar mdzad pa'i sa gsum gyi skye bo rnam par gzhag pa'i nang na /
translated: Among the arrangement of the three worlds, which is the abode of victory,

original: lha chen po ni mchog yin la de yang dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs nas phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil gyi 'og nas srog gi dbang po dang bral bar gnas te /
analyzed: lha chen po ni mchog yin la de yang dkyil 'khor thams cad du zhugs nas phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil gyi 'og nas srog gi dbang po dang bral bar gnas te /
translated: the great god is supreme. Having entered all maṇḍalas, he remains devoid of the faculty of life from under the soles of Vajrapāṇi’s feet.

original: de bas na de las thar bar bya ba'i phyir yang /
analyzed: de bas na de las thar bar bya ba'i phyir yang /
translated: Therefore, in order to liberate him,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus te zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'dus te zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, having gathered together all the Tathagatas,

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal bar gsol ba gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal bar gsol ba gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to request the three worlds to be victorious,

original: sngar 'dus pa mdzad pa yin la de la ltos pas na yang zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sngar 'dus pa mdzad pa yin la de la ltos pas na yang zhes gsungs so //
translated: having previously made an assembly, in dependence upon that, he said “again”.

original: mkhyen bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ma shi ba dang / bdag cag gis bskul na /
analyzed: mkhyen bzhin du zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ma shi ba dang / bdag cag gis bskul na /
translated: “Knowing” means that he knows that this one is not dead, and that if we request him,🔽he will certainly give him up.

original: gdon mi za bar gtong ngo zhes de ltar mkhyen bzhin du /🔽byang chub @2a * //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar gtong ngo zhes de ltar mkhyen bzhin du / byang chub @2a * //
translated: In that way, knowing,

original: sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje la bka' stsal pa /
translated: he spoke to the great Bodhisattva Vajrapani,

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' nyon cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bka' nyon cig ces gsungs so //
translated: saying, “Blessed One, listen to the words of all the Tathagatas.”

original: mnyan par bya ba'i bka' de yang gang yin zhe na dbang phyug chen po'i lus 'di khyod kyi rkang pa'i 'og nas gtang bar byos zhes bya ba 'di ni mnyan par bya ba'i bka' yin no //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba'i bka' de yang gang yin zhe na dbang phyug chen po'i lus 'di khyod kyi rkang pa'i 'og nas gtang bar byos zhes bya ba 'di ni mnyan par bya ba'i bka' yin no //
translated: What are those words that should be listened to? “Let go of this body of Mahesvara under your foot.” This is the word that should be listened to.

original: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de skad ces bka' stsal ba dang / bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having said this, Vajrapāṇi, the Blessed One, said to all the Tathāgatas:

original: bdag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rungs pa thams cad gdul ba'i khro bor dbang bskur nas /
analyzed: bdag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis ma rungs pa thams cad gdul ba'i khro bor dbang bskur nas /
translated: “I, having been consecrated by the Blessed One as the wrathful one who subdues all the wicked,

original: de bdag gis bkum  lags na /
analyzed: de bdag gis bkum  lags na /
translated: have killed him.

original: ji ltar bdag gis de gtang bar bgyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis de gtang bar bgyi /
translated: How should I release him?”

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes de skad ces gsol ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang phyug chen po'i lus de gso ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes de skad ces gsol ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis dbang phyug chen po'i lus de gso ba'i phyir /
translated: When Vajrapāṇi, the Blessed One, had said this, all the Tathāgatas, in order to revive the body of Maheśvara,

original: shi ba'i rnam par shes pa dgug pa'i snying po 'di bka' stsal to //
analyzed: shi ba'i rnam par shes pa dgug pa'i snying po 'di bka' stsal to //
translated: recited this essence of the consciousness of the dead:

original: shi ba zhes bya ba ni brgyal ba la bya ste /
analyzed: shi ba zhes bya ba ni brgyal ba la bya ste /
translated: “The so-called dead is to be understood as fainting.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa gnyid kyis log pa'i 'du shes kyis yul gzhan dang ; 'gro ba gzhan dang / phyogs gzhan du rmi lam zhes bya ba'i snang ba bskyed do //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa gnyid kyis log pa'i 'du shes kyis yul gzhan dang ; 'gro ba gzhan dang / phyogs gzhan du rmi lam zhes bya ba'i snang ba bskyed do //
translated: His consciousness, by the perception of sleep, produces the appearance called dream in another place, another realm, and another direction.”

original: gnyid log pa de rmi lam du sad par byed pa'i rkyen mthong ba gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa de'i sngon gyi gzhi las skyes pa'i rgyu byed pa la ni sad par byed pa zhes @2b bya ste ;
analyzed: gnyid log pa de rmi lam du sad par byed pa'i rkyen mthong ba gang yin pa de rnam par shes pa de'i sngon gyi gzhi las skyes pa'i rgyu byed pa la ni sad par byed pa zhes @2b bya ste ;
translated: The condition that causes the one who is asleep to awaken from the dream is the cause that produces the consciousness of the one who is awake.

original: dper na skyes bu dug gis zin pa'i lus ni g-yo ba med cing gnyid stug pos non pa dang 'dra bar gnas so //
analyzed: dper na skyes bu dug gis zin pa'i lus ni g-yo ba med cing gnyid stug pos non pa dang 'dra bar gnas so //
translated: For example, the body of a person who has been poisoned remains motionless, as if overcome by deep sleep.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa de yang brgyal bar gyur cing /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa de yang brgyal bar gyur cing /
translated: His consciousness is also as if in a faint,

original: mun nag thibs pos bkab pa bzhin du 'du shes med par gnas so //
analyzed: mun nag thibs pos bkab pa bzhin du 'du shes med par gnas so //
translated: as if covered by a thick darkness, and he remains without any perception.

original: mun nag gi gnas lha bu dug gis myos pa de sngags pa 'ga' zhig gis bsal bar byas pa dang / des de'i brgyal ba bsal bas rnam par shes pa de'i mun nag sel bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mun nag gi gnas lha bu dug gis myos pa de sngags pa 'ga' zhig gis bsal bar byas pa dang / des de'i brgyal ba bsal bas rnam par shes pa de'i mun nag sel bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When a son of the gods who is in a dark place and intoxicated by poison is cured by a certain mantra, the consciousness of that one who is cured is said to be cleared of darkness.

original: lus der 'du shes gsal ba bskyed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'o zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: lus der 'du shes gsal ba bskyed pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa 'jug pa'o zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: It is also said that consciousness enters in order to generate a clear perception in that body.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang dbang phyug chen po'i lus dug dang gnyid kyis non pa bzhin du brgyal bar gnas la de'i rnam par shes pa de yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor la mnyam par gzhag pa'i mthus /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang dbang phyug chen po'i lus dug dang gnyid kyis non pa bzhin du brgyal bar gnas la de'i rnam par shes pa de yang rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor la mnyam par gzhag pa'i mthus /
translated: In the same way, here, the body of Maheśvara is unconscious, as if it were affected by poison or sleep, and his consciousness, by the power of the yogi’s meditative concentration,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thal bas khebs pa zhes bya bar rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa ltar 'gro ba gzhan dang / yul gzhan du bdag gi lus phyin pa snyam du sems so ;
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thal bas khebs pa zhes bya bar rmi lam gyi rnam par shes pa ltar 'gro ba gzhan dang / yul gzhan du bdag gi lus phyin pa snyam du sems so ;
translated: goes to another world and another place, as if in a dream, and thinks that his body has gone there.

original: / de bzhin du thal bas khebs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams der bdag nyid sangs rgyas par snang bar rmi lam ltar sems so //
analyzed: / de bzhin du thal bas khebs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams der bdag nyid sangs rgyas par snang bar rmi lam ltar sems so //
translated: In the same way, in that world covered with ashes, he dreams that he appears as a buddha.

original: de nas snying po 'dis rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par shes pa zhes gang bshad pa rnal 'byor bsgoms pas 'phangs te shi bar btags pa gnyid kyis log pa dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: de nas snying po 'dis rmi lam lta bu'i rnam par shes pa zhes gang bshad pa rnal 'byor bsgoms pas 'phangs te shi bar btags pa gnyid kyis log pa dang 'dra ba'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de /
translated: Then, the consciousness that was explained as being like a dream, projected by the force of the yogi’s meditation, which is called “death,” which is like falling asleep,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa snyam du snang ba skye ba las phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil gyi 'og nas phyung zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa snyam du snang ba skye ba las phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil gyi 'og nas phyung zhing /
translated: The thought arises that the Tathāgata is seen, and Vajrapāṇi is drawn out from under the sole of his foot.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i byin gyi rlabs bsdus pa dang / gnyid log pa las sad pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i byin gyi rlabs bsdus pa dang / gnyid log pa las sad pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: The yogi’s blessing is gathered, and like waking from sleep,

original: slar yang dbang phyug chen po'i lus rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs bdag nyid yin no snyam pa'i so sor snang ba skyes te /
analyzed: slar yang dbang phyug chen po'i lus rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i gzugs bdag nyid yin no snyam pa'i so sor snang ba skyes te /
translated: the individual appearance arises again, thinking “I am the form born from the maturation of Maheśvara’s body.”

original: de lta bu 'di la ni shi ba'i rnam par shes pa 'gugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu 'di la ni shi ba'i rnam par shes pa 'gugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “summoning the consciousness of the dead.”

original: de nas 'di'i phyag rgya bcings pa bshad de /
analyzed: de nas 'di'i phyag rgya bcings pa bshad de /
translated: Next, the mudra of this [deity] is explained:

original: gsang ba'i lcags kyu bsdam byas te //
analyzed: gsang ba'i lcags kyu bsdam byas te //
translated: “Form the secret hook,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: gsang ba'i lcags kyu ni rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyu'i tshul du gzung ngo //
analyzed: gsang ba'i lcags kyu ni rdo rje bsdams pa nang du bcings la mdzub mo gnyis lcags kyu'i tshul du gzung ngo //
translated: The secret hook is the vajra bond bound inside, holding the two index fingers in the shape of a hook.

original: de ltar bcings nas /
analyzed: de ltar bcings nas /
translated: Having bound it like that,

original: mtha' ma mnyam du brkyangs nas ni //
analyzed: mtha' ma mnyam du brkyangs nas ni //
translated: extend the tips equally.

original: zhes bya ba la mthe'u chung gnyis mnyam du brkyang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mthe'u chung gnyis mnyam du brkyang bar bya'o //
translated: The two little fingers are the two little fingers, extended together.

original: shi ba'i mgo bor bzhag na ni //
analyzed: shi ba'i mgo bor bzhag na ni //
translated: If one places it on the head of a dead person,

original: zhes bya ba ni brgyal ba'i spyi bor bzhag la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brgyal ba'i spyi bor bzhag la /
translated: one should place it on the head of the one who has fainted.

original: sngags pas yid kyis sems can @3a * //
analyzed: sngags pas yid kyis sems can @3a * //
translated: The mind of the sentient being is the mind of the one who has fainted.🔽 The condition is the condition that caused the fainting.

original: rkyen gang gis brgyal bar 'gyur ba de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen po bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen gang gis brgyal bar 'gyur ba de dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnyen po bsal bar bya ste /
translated: The remedy is the remedy that is suitable for that condition.

original: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis kyi zla ba'i bla ma'i byang chub kyi sems kyi phyag rgya las byung ba'i bdud rtsi'i chus dbang bskur zhing /
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil gnyis kyi zla ba'i bla ma'i byang chub kyi sems kyi phyag rgya las byung ba'i bdud rtsi'i chus dbang bskur zhing /
translated: The water of elixir is the water of elixir that arises from the mudra of the bodhicitta of the guru of the moon on the two soles of the feet.🔽 The form is the form of the sentient being.🔽 The mudra is the mudra that is summoned from the realm of Yama.

original: sems can de'i cha byad ji lta bu yin pa de lta bu'i cha byad du gshin rje'i yul nas phyag rgya 'dis drangs te spyi bor bzhag la spyi bo nas lus kyi yan lag thams cad du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can de'i cha byad ji lta bu yin pa de lta bu'i cha byad du gshin rje'i yul nas phyag rgya 'dis drangs te spyi bor bzhag la spyi bo nas lus kyi yan lag thams cad du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The crown of the head is the crown of the head of the sentient being.🔽 The limbs are the limbs of the body.

original: de nas yan lag thams cad kyang sor chud pas rtsol ba dang bcas pa dang / g-yo ba dang bcas par gyur pa'am //
analyzed: de nas yan lag thams cad kyang sor chud pas rtsol ba dang bcas pa dang / g-yo ba dang bcas par gyur pa'am //
translated: The restoration is the restoration of all the limbs.🔽 The effort is the effort of the sentient being.🔽 The movement is the movement of the sentient being.

original: de'i lus kyi nang du bcug ma thag tu langs te 'dug gam /
analyzed: de'i lus kyi nang du bcug ma thag tu langs te 'dug gam /
translated: As soon as he enters his body, he stands up and sits there.

original: bsgreng bar bsams la lce la rdo rje bsams na langs pa'am smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgreng bar bsams la lce la rdo rje bsams na langs pa'am smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one imagines a vajra on his tongue, he stands up and speaks.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi man ngag las /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyi man ngag las /
translated: Thus, by the instruction of the Lord,

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje sngags dang / phyag rgya mdzad pa dang / de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams de dag nas byon te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje sngags dang / phyag rgya mdzad pa dang / de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad 'jig rten gyi khams de dag nas byon te /
translated: the Lord Vajrapāṇi, having performed the mantra and the seal, then all the Tathāgatas came from those world systems,

original: de'i lus kyi nang du zhugs par gyur nas ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do //
analyzed: de'i lus kyi nang du zhugs par gyur nas ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do //
translated: and having entered into his body, they uttered this utterance:

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: “Amazing!” means “astonished.”

original: ci zhig ngo mtshar yin zhe na /🔽sangs rgyas ye shes bla na med //
analyzed: ci zhig ngo mtshar yin zhe na / sangs rgyas ye shes bla na med //
translated: What is amazing?

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: “The unsurpassed wisdom of the Buddha”🔽means

original: shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: “extremely exalted.”

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dir ci'i phyir ngo mtshar che zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dir ci'i phyir ngo mtshar che zhe na /
translated: Why is this wisdom of the Buddha amazing here?

original: gang phyir zhi ba'i lus 'di yang //
analyzed: gang phyir zhi ba'i lus 'di yang //
translated: “Because this peaceful body

original: 'tsho ba'i khams su gyur pa yin //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i khams su gyur pa yin //
translated: becomes the element of life.”

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is.

original: de ltar 'tsho bar mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje rkang pa 'degs pa zhes bya ba'i snying po 'di gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar 'tsho bar mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje rkang pa 'degs pa zhes bya ba'i snying po 'di gsungs te /
translated: Having thus sustained life, the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi spoke this essence called “Raising the Foot”:

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas lus de la 'tsho ba'i khams dang ldan par mdzad cing /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas lus de la 'tsho ba'i khams dang ldan par mdzad cing /
translated: Thus the Tathāgata endowed that body with the element of life,

original: dbang po nyams pa med pa /
analyzed: dbang po nyams pa med pa /
translated: without impaired faculties,

original: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'os par mdzad nas rkang ba bteg pa zhes bya ba'i snying po gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skye bar 'os par mdzad nas rkang ba bteg pa zhes bya ba'i snying po gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and fit for the arising of consciousness, spoke the essence called “Raising the Foot.”

original: 'di'i phyag rgya bshad de /
analyzed: 'di'i phyag rgya bshad de /
translated: Its mudrā is explained:

original: rdo rje khro bo'i mdzub legs par /
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo'i mdzub legs par /
translated: The excellent vajra wrathful index fingers

original: zur sprad bsdams te bzhag na ni //
analyzed: zur sprad bsdams te bzhag na ni //
translated: are joined at the tips and placed.

original: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje khro bo gnyis kyi mdzub mo gnyis gcig la gcig zur sprad la brtan por byas la bzlog ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rdo rje khro bo gnyis kyi mdzub mo gnyis gcig la gcig zur sprad la brtan por byas la bzlog ste /
translated: This means that the two index fingers of the two vajra wrathful ones are joined tip to tip, made firm, and reversed.

original: de nas rdo rje zhes bya ba la ltung ba bzlog pa'i rdo rje 'og tu song bas dbyung bar bya ba'i dngos po bzung la /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje zhes bya ba la ltung ba bzlog pa'i rdo rje 'og tu song bas dbyung bar bya ba'i dngos po bzung la /
translated: Then, with the vajra called “falling,” the vajra that goes below, one should grasp the thing to be raised up,

original: snying po 'dis slar gdeg cing /
analyzed: snying po 'dis slar gdeg cing /
translated: and with this essence, one should raise it up again.

original: phyag rgya gyen la bstan te dgrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya gyen la bstan te dgrol bar bya'o //
translated: The seal is to be released with the palm upward.

original: 'di gsungs ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni rkang pa 'degs pa'i phyag rgya'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i zhabs kyi 'og nas lha chen po thar par rang gis shes par gyur to //🔽de nas @3b zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'di gsungs ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni rkang pa 'degs pa'i phyag rgya'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i zhabs kyi 'og nas lha chen po thar par rang gis shes par gyur to // de nas @3b zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
translated: As soon as this was said, by the application of the seal of raising the foot, Maheśvara was freed from under the foot of the Great Vajra-holder, and he knew it himself.🔽Then, at that time, the Blessed One, the Tathagata Vajra-Holder,

original: dbang phyug chen po'i lus de de bzhin gshegs pa des zhes bya ba ni thal ba'i dbang po'i dbyangs kyis so //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po'i lus de de bzhin gshegs pa des zhes bya ba ni thal ba'i dbang po'i dbyangs kyis so //
translated: the body of Maheśvara,🔽blessed it to be restored,

original: sos par byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni tshe dang drod dang rnam par shes pa dang ldan par byas pa'o //
analyzed: sos par byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba ni tshe dang drod dang rnam par shes pa dang ldan par byas pa'o //
translated: endowed with life, warmth, and consciousness.

original: 'di skad ston te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi mthus gang thal bas khebs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su thal ba'i dbang po'i dbyangs yin no snyam du snang ba skyes pa myong ba'i rnam par shes pa de yang bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas🔽'phangs pa'i zhabs bteg pa des /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnal 'byor gyi mthus gang thal bas khebs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams su thal ba'i dbang po'i dbyangs yin no snyam du snang ba skyes pa myong ba'i rnam par shes pa de yang bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i rnal 'byor bsgoms pas 'phangs pa'i zhabs bteg pa des /
translated: is the consciousness that is the object of the foot that is raised by the meditation on the yoga of Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi.

original: rnam par smin pa'i lus kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa dang ldan par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i lus kyi dbang po rnam par shes pa dang ldan par mdzad pa'o //
translated: That consciousness is made to possess the consciousness of the ripening body sense faculty.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir rgyal tshab tu bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni mi mjed kyi 'jig rten gyi khams 'dir rgyal tshab tu bzhag pa'o //
translated: In this world realm means in this Sahā world realm, he is appointed as regent.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sems can thams cad kyi don dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / sems can thams cad kyi don dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of all sentient beings means in order to accomplish the aims of all sentient beings.

original: ma rungs pa thams cad gdul ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir drag po zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: ma rungs pa thams cad gdul ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma rungs pa'i sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir drag po zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: For the purpose of subduing all the wicked ones means that for the purpose of subduing wicked sentient beings, he is also called fierce.

original: nyid kyi rgyal tshab tu bcug go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyid kyi rgyal tshab tu bcug go zhes bya ba la /
translated: He was installed as his own regent.

original: rgyal po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po ni bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The king is the Blessed One Vajradhara,

original: lha chen po ni de'i rgyal tshab bo //
analyzed: lha chen po ni de'i rgyal tshab bo //
translated: and the great god is his regent.

original: gzhan yang rang gi rigs kyi mtshan ma de spyi bor gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang gi rigs kyi mtshan ma de spyi bor gzhag par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to place that sign of his own family on the crown of his head,

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i nyid kyi zhabs kyi mthil nas zla ba'i bla ma zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i byang chub sems kyi phyag rgya byung ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje'i nyid kyi zhabs kyi mthil nas zla ba'i bla ma zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad du gtogs pa'i byang chub sems kyi phyag rgya byung ngo //
translated: from the sole of his own foot, the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi emitted the moon-like guru named The One Who Has Appeared from the Sole of the Foot of the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi, the seal of the bodhicitta belonging to all tathāgatas.

original: de nas 'di'i phyag rgya bcings pa bshad de /
analyzed: de nas 'di'i phyag rgya bcings pa bshad de /
translated: Then, his seal is explained:

original: lha chen po'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa de brlan pa phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyis mnan pa'i phyogs gang du phyag rgya dang rig par bcas te bzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lha chen po'i rnal 'byor la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa de brlan pa phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyis mnan pa'i phyogs gang du phyag rgya dang rig par bcas te bzhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The yogin who is established in the yoga of the great deity is placed together with the seal and the knowledge mantra in the direction that is trodden by the foot of the wet Vajrapāṇi.

original: phyag rgya 'di'i mtshan nyid ni gsal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'di'i mtshan nyid ni gsal ba nyid yin no //
translated: The characteristic of this seal is clarity.

original: de nas 'di byung ma thag tu zhes pa ni rig pa'o //
analyzed: de nas 'di byung ma thag tu zhes pa ni rig pa'o //
translated: Then, as soon as this arises, means the knowledge mantra.

original: zhabs kyi mthil de las zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil las so //
analyzed: zhabs kyi mthil de las zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil las so //
translated: From the sole of his foot means from the sole of the foot of Vajrapāṇi.

original: zla ba'i bla ma de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa'i sgo nyid nas yon tan thams cad bsdus pa 'di ni zla ba'i bla ma de bzhin gshegs pa de /
analyzed: zla ba'i bla ma de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa'i sgo nyid nas yon tan thams cad bsdus pa 'di ni zla ba'i bla ma de bzhin gshegs pa de /
translated: The Tathāgata Candrājñānin means the Tathāgata who, by the door of cultivating the thought of awakening, has gathered all good qualities.

original: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: zla ba'i dkyil 'khor lta bu'i byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the thought of awakening is like the orb of the moon.

original: byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems bsgom pa gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cultivation of the thought of awakening is primary.

original: phyag na rdo rje yang sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir //🔽bcom ldan 'das rdo rje @4a * //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje yang sems can rnams gdul ba'i phyir // bcom ldan 'das rdo rje @4a * //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, too, in order to tame sentient beings,🔽resides in the body of the Blessed One, Vajra

original: h'um mdzad kyi skur bzhugs te /
analyzed: h'um mdzad kyi skur bzhugs te /
translated: Hūṃkāra.

original: sku de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //🔽de bas na phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil nas /
analyzed: sku de yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid do // de bas na phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil nas /
translated: And that body is the very essence of the atoms of the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar byung zhes rnam par rtog pa mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ji ltar byung zhes rnam par rtog pa mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not think that the Tathāgata arose from the sole of Vajrapāṇi’s foot.

original: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes ji skad du bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: Then, etc. — by the method explained by the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi,

original: lha chen po'i lus la 'tsho ba'i dbang po byin zhing zhabs kyi 'og nas kyang btang ste /
analyzed: lha chen po'i lus la 'tsho ba'i dbang po byin zhing zhabs kyi 'og nas kyang btang ste /
translated: he gave life to the body of the Great God and released him from under his foot.

original: zla ba'i bla ma byang chub kyi sems kyi phyag rgyas kyang dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: zla ba'i bla ma byang chub kyi sems kyi phyag rgyas kyang dbang bskur ro //
translated: He also conferred empowerment with the mudrā of bodhicitta, the moon.

original: sngar ni stobs kyis gcer bur phyung ste dkyil 'khor du bcug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sngar ni stobs kyis gcer bur phyung ste dkyil 'khor du bcug pa yin gyi /
translated: Previously, he was forcibly pulled out naked and placed in the maṇḍala.

original: da ltar ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis phyag na rdo rje'i grogs su dbang bskur ba yin no //
analyzed: da ltar ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis phyag na rdo rje'i grogs su dbang bskur ba yin no //
translated: Now, all the Tathagatas have empowered you as Vajrapani's companion.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil la reg pas byang chub kyi sems kyis byin gyis brlabs pas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi mthil la reg pas byang chub kyi sems kyis byin gyis brlabs pas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: You are a Bodhisattva because you are blessed by the thought of enlightenment by touching the soles of Vajrapani's feet.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don byed par bskos pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i don byed par bskos pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: You are a Great Being because you are appointed to work for the welfare of the great host of sentient beings.

original: mdud rtse des zhes bya ba ni rdo rjes mtshan pa'i mdud rtses so //
analyzed: mdud rtse des zhes bya ba ni rdo rjes mtshan pa'i mdud rtses so //
translated: With that tip means with the tip marked by the vajra.

original: nga rgyal dang khengs pa dang dregs pa dang bral zhing yang dag pa'i lam rnyed par dka' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar bskor zhing zhes bya ba mdung gi yu ba bskor ba'i tshul gyis te /
analyzed: nga rgyal dang khengs pa dang dregs pa dang bral zhing yang dag pa'i lam rnyed par dka' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mgal me'i 'khor lo ltar bskor zhing zhes bya ba mdung gi yu ba bskor ba'i tshul gyis te /
translated: You should whirl it like a firebrand, saying HUM! in order to be free from pride, arrogance, and conceit, and in order to make the right path difficult to find.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gar gyi mchod pas mchod pa byas nas 'og nas bshad pa'i ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje dang de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la gar gyi mchod pas mchod pa byas nas 'og nas bshad pa'i ched du brjod pa 'di ched du brjod do //
translated: The Bhagavat Vajrapani, having worshipped all the Tathagatas with the worship of dance, uttered this utterance for the purpose of explaining what follows:

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: Emaho! means astonishing!

original: su zhig gi ngo mtshar zhe na /
analyzed: su zhig gi ngo mtshar zhe na /
translated: Whose astonishment?

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The all buddhas.

original: ci zhig ngo mtshar che zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig ngo mtshar che zhe na /
translated: What is astonishing?

original: byang chub sems ni bla na med //🔽ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bla na med // ces bya ba'o //
translated: The unsurpassed enlightenment mind.

original: ji ltar ngo mtshar du gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ngo mtshar du gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it astonishing?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because

original: zhabs mchog gis ni gang reg pa'am //🔽sangs rgyas nyid du grub pa 'thob //
analyzed: zhabs mchog gis ni gang reg pa'am // sangs rgyas nyid du grub pa 'thob //
translated: he who is touched by the supreme feet

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: attains the accomplishment of buddhahood.

original: 'di skad ston te dpal rdo rje 'dzin pa'i zhabs kyi mthil gyis reg pa tsam gyis byang chub kyi sems kyi yon tan rnams skyes shing /
analyzed: 'di skad ston te dpal rdo rje 'dzin pa'i zhabs kyi mthil gyis reg pa tsam gyis byang chub kyi sems kyi yon tan rnams skyes shing /
translated: This is what is being taught: By merely being touched by the soles of the feet of the glorious Vajra Holder, the qualities of enlightenment mind are born,

original: thal ba'i dbang po'i dbyings kyi sangs rgyas su 'gyur re /
analyzed: thal ba'i dbang po'i dbyings kyi sangs rgyas su 'gyur re /
translated: and one becomes a buddha in the realm of the ashes.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rang la snang ba'i gnas skabs ched du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing rang la snang ba'i gnas skabs ched du brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is a special statement about the occasion of one's own buddha-field appearing to oneself.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni lcang lo can na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' chen po phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni lcang lo can na gnas pa'o //
translated: Then, the great bodhisattva Vajrapāṇi, who resides in the Nāga world,

original: rdo rje khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas zhes bya ba ni khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs nas gnas pa'o //
translated: arises from that vajra wrathful meditative stabilization, that is, having entered into the meditative equipoise of wrathful meditative stabilization, he resides.

original: gang gi @4b zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi @4b zhe na /
translated: With regard to whom?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid rdo rje h'um mdzad du gyur te /
translated: The Tathāgata himself becomes Vajra Hūṃkāra.

original: de'i nang du zhugs shing de la babs nas des 'di dag thams cad mdzad do //
analyzed: de'i nang du zhugs shing de la babs nas des 'di dag thams cad mdzad do //
translated: Having entered into him and descended upon him, he performs all of these.

original: da ni khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i tshe /
analyzed: da ni khro bo'i ting nge 'dzin las ldang ba'i tshe /
translated: Now, at the time of arising from the wrathful meditative stabilization,

original: bcom ldan 'das de nas byung zhing de'i babs pa dang yang bral bar 'gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nas byung zhing de'i babs pa dang yang bral bar 'gyur to //
translated: the Blessed One emerges from that and also becomes separated from his descent.

original: babs pa dang bral nas ;
analyzed: babs pa dang bral nas ;
translated: Having become separated from his descent,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du bka' nod cing gnas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du bka' nod cing gnas te /
translated: he stands in the presence of the Blessed One, receiving his instructions.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bdag gi tshug par rdo rje stsal te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis bdag gi tshug par rdo rje stsal te /
translated: The Blessed One, all the Tathagatas, have given me the Vajra of the Mind,🔽and have consecrated me as Vajrapani.

original: phyag na rdo rje nyid du dbang bskur bas zhes bya ba ste dkyil 'khor brtag pa la nges par sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje nyid du dbang bskur bas zhes bya ba ste dkyil 'khor brtag pa la nges par sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning: “Having connected with the ascertainment of the mandala,

original: de lta bas na lha la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs de rnams zhes bya ba ni lha chen po la sogs pa'o //🔽'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na lha la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi rdo rje'i rigs de rnams zhes bya ba ni lha chen po la sogs pa'o // 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i dkyil 'khor chen po 'di la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: therefore, those external Vajra families of gods and so forth” are the great gods and so forth.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa'i gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa'i gtso bo ste /
translated: “In this great mandala of the Conqueror of the Three Worlds” is the principal conception of the Conqueror of the Three Worlds.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtogs pa'i rjes la zhes bya ba'i don to ;
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtogs pa'i rjes la zhes bya ba'i don to ;
translated: The meaning is “after the conception of the Conqueror of the Three Worlds.”

original: / gnas pa'i rim pa bgyis nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rnam par dgod par bgyi'o /
analyzed: / gnas pa'i rim pa bgyis nas zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor rnam par dgod par bgyi'o /
translated: “Having arranged the sequence of the places” is “I will arrange the mandala of the wheel of the three worlds.”

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo la 'jug pa'o //
translated: “By whom” refers to the entry into the wheel of Dharma.

original: sems can de rnams zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rdo rje rigs kyis yang dag par bsdus pa rnams so //
analyzed: sems can de rnams zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi rdo rje rigs kyis yang dag par bsdus pa rnams so //
translated: “Those sentient beings” refers to those who are gathered by the external vajra family.

original: phyir mi ldog par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med par bgyi'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “I will make them irreversible” means I will make them non-returning.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las skyes so //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las skyes so //
translated: From the unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la gnang bar gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba'i tshul du sems dpa' gtsug tor gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rjes bcom ldan 'das la gnang bar gsol ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba'i tshul du sems dpa' gtsug tor gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, having requested the Bhagavān to grant permission, Vajrapāṇi, the Bhagavān, spoke the uṣṇīṣa-being.

original: de nas 'di gsungs ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: de nas 'di gsungs ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal ma thag tu'o //
translated: Then, as soon as this was said, means as soon as it was spoken.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor rnams las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor rnams las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From the uṣṇīṣas of all the tathāgatas means

original: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje de nyid 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs su gyur te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje de nyid 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs su gyur te /
translated: that very Bhagavān Vajrapāṇi became various kinds of light rays.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor las byung zhing 'jig rten gyi khams du ma snang bar byas nas yang bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rang gi spyi bo nyid du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor las byung zhing 'jig rten gyi khams du ma snang bar byas nas yang bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje zhes bya ba ni rang gi spyi bo nyid du'o //
translated: Then, having arisen from the uṣṇīṣas of all the tathāgatas, having illuminated many world systems, [the light] again entered the head of the Blessed One Vajrapāṇi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor gyi tshul du 'phung nas 'khod do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor lta bu phung por gyur nas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor gyi tshul du 'phung nas 'khod do zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor lta bu phung por gyur nas gnas pa'o //
translated: Having entered, it became a mass in the form of an uṣṇīṣa of all the tathāgatas.

original: de nas @5a * //
analyzed: de nas @5a * //
translated: Then, from that mass of splendor,

original: gzi brjid phung po de las zhes bya ba ni gang 'di de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor nas byung ste /
analyzed: gzi brjid phung po de las zhes bya ba ni gang 'di de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gtsug tor nas byung ste /
translated: that is, having arisen from the uṣṇīṣas of all the tathāgatas,

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i spyi bor gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa'i spyi bor gnas pa'o //
translated: it entered the head of Vajradhara.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gnang ba'i tshul lta bu ni sngags gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gnang ba'i tshul lta bu ni sngags gnyis pa'o //
translated: Then, the manner of being permitted by all the tathāgatas is the second mantra.

original: sngags de gnyis ka yang rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas kyi yin no //
analyzed: sngags de gnyis ka yang rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas kyi yin no //
translated: Both of those mantras are for the abode of Vairocana.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi mdun du ni nges par gnod mdzes rdo rje ste de'i thugs kar ro //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas logs su ni rdo rje snying po 'khor lo la brten te bzhugs pa'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das kyi snam logs su ni rdo rje spyan padma la brten te bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi mdun du ni nges par gnod mdzes rdo rje ste de'i thugs kar ro // bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yas logs su ni rdo rje snying po 'khor lo la brten te bzhugs pa'o // bcom ldan 'das kyi snam logs su ni rdo rje spyan padma la brten te bzhugs pa'o //
translated: In front of the Bhagavat Vairocana is definitely Vajraketu, in his heart.🔽To the right of the Bhagavat is Vajracitta, standing on a wheel.🔽To the left of the Bhagavat is Vajranetra, standing on a lotus.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yon logs su ni rdo rje sna tshogs padma la brten te bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi g-yon logs su ni rdo rje sna tshogs padma la brten te bzhugs pa'o //
translated: To the right of the Bhagavat is Vajrasūrya, standing on a lotus.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi drung na rdo rje rig pa mchog zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i zhabs kyi drung na rdo rje rig pa mchog zhabs la phyag 'tshal ba'i tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: At the feet of Vajrapāṇi is Vajravidyottama, standing at his feet in a gesture of homage.

original: de ltar byas na rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor du gsum 'jog ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas na rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi dkyil 'khor du gsum 'jog ste /
translated: In this way, three are placed in the maṇḍala of Vajrahūṃkāra:

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje h'um mdzad dang / de'i thugs kar 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang / zhabs kyi drung na rdo rje rig pa mchog go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje h'um mdzad dang / de'i thugs kar 'dod pa'i rgyal po dang / zhabs kyi drung na rdo rje rig pa mchog go //
translated: the Bhagavat Vajrahūṃkāra, in his heart the King of Desire, and at his feet Vajravidyottama.

original: dad pa'i sems kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa'i zhabs la 'dud pa'i phyir rdo rje rig pa mchog ces bshad do //
analyzed: dad pa'i sems kyis rdo rje 'dzin pa'i zhabs la 'dud pa'i phyir rdo rje rig pa mchog ces bshad do //
translated: The vajra is the vajra-holder, because he is bowed to by the faithful mind.

original: rang gi mthu ston pa'i phyir rdo rje khro bo zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: rang gi mthu ston pa'i phyir rdo rje khro bo zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: The vajra is also called vajra-anger because he displays his own power.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni zhabs la phyag 'bul ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la phyag 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni zhabs la phyag 'bul ba'o //
translated: Having bowed to the two feet of the Lord means he bows to the feet.

original: yang rang gi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir snying po 'di gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang rang gi rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir snying po 'di gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Again, in order to show his own nature, he utters this essence-mantra:

original: rim pa gnyis pa'i shar phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de'i dbus su rdo rje bzhag la /🔽rgyal po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor bya ste /
analyzed: rim pa gnyis pa'i shar phyogs kyi dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de'i dbus su rdo rje bzhag la / rgyal po bzhi'i dkyil 'khor bya ste /
translated: In the center of the mandala in the east of the second stage, he places the vajra. 🔽He should draw the mandala of the four kings.

original: dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: dgod par bya'o //
translated: He should draw the four vajras. 🔽In the same way, in the center of the mandala in line with the southern gate, he places the vajra to be drawn, and he should draw the four wrathful ones beginning with Vajra-Amogha and the two lords of the hosts.

original: de bzhin du lho phyogs kyi sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de'i dbus su bri ba'i rdo rje bzhag la rdo rje 'khyil pa la sogs pa khro bo bzhi dang / tshogs kyi bdag po rnams gnyis pa nyid du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lho phyogs kyi sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa de'i dbus su bri ba'i rdo rje bzhag la rdo rje 'khyil pa la sogs pa khro bo bzhi dang / tshogs kyi bdag po rnams gnyis pa nyid du bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the center of the mandala in line with the western gate, he places the vajra to be drawn, and he should draw the four wrathful ones beginning with Vajra-Amogha and the two lords of the hosts. 🔽In the center of the mandala in line with the northern gate, he places the vajra to be drawn, and he should draw the four wrathful ones beginning with Vajra-Amogha and the two lords of the hosts.

original: nub phyogs kyi sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje nyid bzhag la /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje nyid bzhag la /
translated: Having placed the vajra in the center of the maṇḍala directly in front of the western door,

original: rdo rje gtum po la sogs pa pho nya bzhi rim bzhin bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gtum po la sogs pa pho nya bzhi rim bzhin bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw the four messengers beginning with Vajra Caṇḍa in order.

original: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs kyi sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje bzhag la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs kyi sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje bzhag la /
translated: For that very reason, having placed the vajra in the center of the maṇḍala directly in front of the door of the quarter,

original: rdo rje'i lcags kyu la sogs pa bran bzhi rim bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i lcags kyu la sogs pa bran bzhi rim bzhin du bri bar bya'o //
translated: one should draw the four servants beginning with the vajra hook in order.

original: shar gyi sgo nas brtsams te sgo bzhir ni rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa bzhi rim bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: shar gyi sgo nas brtsams te sgo bzhir ni rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa bzhi rim bzhin du dgod par bya'o //
translated: Beginning from the eastern door, one should arrange the four beginning with the vajra hook in the four doors in order.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
translated: Then, at that time, the Blessed One, the Tathagata Vajrapani,

original: rdo rje rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po yin pas na rdo rje rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po yin pas na rdo rje rigs kyi dkyil 'khor chen po ste /
translated: the great maṇḍala of the Vajra Family,

original: @5b 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @5b 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the Cakra of the Three Worlds,

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: dwelling in his own mind,

original: bshad do zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad do zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'o //
translated: taught.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dkyil 'khor chen po dam pa ste //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor chen po dam pa ste // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the holy great maṇḍala.

original: ji ltar thig gdab par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar thig gdab par bya zhe na /
translated: How should one lay out the lines?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / chos kyi dkyil 'khor 'dra ba ni //🔽dkyil 'khor thams cad srad bu bre //
analyzed: de'i phyir / chos kyi dkyil 'khor 'dra ba ni // dkyil 'khor thams cad srad bu bre //
translated: Like the Dharma maṇḍala,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: all maṇḍalas are measured with a string.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni chos kyi 'khor lo dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: Like the Dharma maṇḍala means like the Dharma wheel.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad srad bu bre //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad srad bu bre //
translated: All maṇḍalas are measured with a string.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang du bcas par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang du bcas par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means with the outer and inner.

original: da ni thig gdab pa'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni thig gdab pa'i cho ga bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the rite of laying out the lines,🔽it is said:

original: dkyil 'khor gyi ni dbus su yang //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi ni dbus su yang //
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala,

original: seng ldeng phur pa btab nas ni //
analyzed: seng ldeng phur pa btab nas ni //
translated: having planted an acacia stake,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so forth.

original: bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug la /
analyzed: bgegs dang log 'dren thams cad 'dod pa'i rgyal pos bkug la /
translated: Having summoned all obstructors and misleaders with the king of desire,

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su seng ldeng gi phur pa gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su seng ldeng gi phur pa gdab par bya'o //
translated: one should plant an acacia stake in the center of the maṇḍala.

original: seng ldeng phur pa btab nas ni //
analyzed: seng ldeng phur pa btab nas ni //
translated: Having planted an acacia stake,

original: zhes bya ba nyid ni bgegs thams cad gzhig pa'i phyir dang / dkyil 'khor yang dag par gnas shing rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir gzugs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nyid ni bgegs thams cad gzhig pa'i phyir dang / dkyil 'khor yang dag par gnas shing rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir gzugs pa yin no //
translated: This is for the purpose of destroying all obstacles and for the purpose of establishing and purifying the maṇḍala.🔽Having made two lines,

original: srad bu gnyis rim du byas nas zhes bya ba ni dbyibs rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir srad bu phur bu la dkris te nang gi dkyil 'khor sbyong bar bya'o //
analyzed: srad bu gnyis rim du byas nas zhes bya ba ni dbyibs rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir srad bu phur bu la dkris te nang gi dkyil 'khor sbyong bar bya'o //
translated: means that for the purpose of purifying the shape, the line should be wound around the pin and the inner maṇḍala purified.🔽Endowed with four lines

original: srad bu bzhi dang ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba ni zlum por byas nas phyogs dang mtshams rnams su srad bu bre bar bya'o //
analyzed: srad bu bzhi dang ldan pa dang // zhes bya ba ni zlum por byas nas phyogs dang mtshams rnams su srad bu bre bar bya'o //
translated: means that having made a circle, the lines should be drawn in the directions and subdirections.

original: de yi phyi rol byung nas ni //
analyzed: de yi phyi rol byung nas ni //
translated: Having gone outside of that,

original: zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis par ro /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis par ro /
translated: means in the second stage.🔽Double

original: nyis 'gyur du zhes bya ba ni srad bu'o //🔽de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rim pa dang po'i tshad ji tsam yin pa /
analyzed: nyis 'gyur du zhes bya ba ni srad bu'o // de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rim pa dang po'i tshad ji tsam yin pa /
translated: means the line.🔽So too

original: rim pa gnyis pa'i tshad kyang de tsam du bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis pa'i tshad kyang de tsam du bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: means that the size of the first stage should be made the size of the second stage.

original: rim pa dang po'i ri mo bris pa nas bsngogs te phur pa la thug gi bar de lta bus ni srad bu nyis 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim pa dang po'i ri mo bris pa nas bsngogs te phur pa la thug gi bar de lta bus ni srad bu nyis 'gyur du 'gyur ro //
translated: From the first level of drawing the lines up to the digging and striking with the dagger, the thread is doubled in that way.

original: de yang rim pa gsum du'o //
analyzed: de yang rim pa gsum du'o //
translated: And that is in three stages.

original: zhes bya ba ni rim pa gsum pa yang rim pa dang po'i tshad tsam kho nar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim pa gsum pa yang rim pa dang po'i tshad tsam kho nar bya'o //
translated: This means that the third stage should be exactly the same size as the first stage.

original: rim pa de gsum gyis ni dang po'i srad bu sum bltab tu byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rim pa de gsum gyis ni dang po'i srad bu sum bltab tu byas pa yin no //
translated: By those three stages, the thread of the first is made into three layers.

original: rim pa gsum par bri ba ma smos mod kyi de yang phyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa gsum par bri ba ma smos mod kyi de yang phyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: Although it is not mentioned that it is drawn in the third stage, that will be explained later.

original: srad bu bzhi dang ldan pa dang // zhes gang du smos su zin kyang //
analyzed: srad bu bzhi dang ldan pa dang // zhes gang du smos su zin kyang //
translated: Although it is mentioned that it has four threads,

original: phyogs mtshams kyi ri mo gang yin pa de chos kyi 'khor lo rtsibs kyi dbyibs su bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs mtshams kyi ri mo gang yin pa de chos kyi 'khor lo rtsibs kyi dbyibs su bya ste /
translated: the lines of the directions and sub-directions should be made in the shape of the spokes of the wheel of Dharma.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo chen po'i thig gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo chen po'i thig gdab pa'i cho ga'o //
translated: This is the ritual for laying out the lines of the great wheel of the three worlds.

original: de nas srad bu bres pa der //
analyzed: de nas srad bu bres pa der //
translated: Then, in that woven thread,

original: dag pa'i tshon gyis dgang bar bya //
analyzed: dag pa'i tshon gyis dgang bar bya //
translated: one should fill it with pure colors.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: dag pa ni yongs su bzlas pa dang / shin tu @6a * //
analyzed: dag pa ni yongs su bzlas pa dang / shin tu @6a * //
translated: Purity is the complete recitation.🔽🔽

original: legs par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: legs par brtags pa'o //
translated: Pure means thoroughly purified and well examined.

original: tshon ni dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshon ni dkar po dang ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Colors are white, yellow, and so forth.

original: tshon dgye ba brtsam pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: tshon dgye ba brtsam pa ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one begin to apply the colors?

original: de'i phyir g-yon pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir g-yon pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, with the left, etc.

original: lag mthil g-yon pa na rdo rje yod pa ni g-yon pa'i rdo rje'o //
analyzed: lag mthil g-yon pa na rdo rje yod pa ni g-yon pa'i rdo rje'o //
translated: The left palm has a vajra, which is the left vajra.

original: des byin gyis brlabs pa'i khu tshur nyid ni khu tshur chen po ste /
analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs pa'i khu tshur nyid ni khu tshur chen po ste /
translated: The great fist is the fist consecrated by that.

original: des dang por tshon dgye bar bya'o //
analyzed: des dang por tshon dgye bar bya'o //
translated: With that, one should first apply the colors.

original: de nas phyis ci bde zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nas phyis ci bde zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then, later, as is convenient,

original: g-yas dang g-yon gang rung ba'o //
analyzed: g-yas dang g-yon gang rung ba'o //
translated: means either the right or the left.

original: de ltar thig ji ltar btab pa rnams tshon gyis bkang la phyag rgya rnams kyang bris te de nas dbus su 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar thig ji ltar btab pa rnams tshon gyis bkang la phyag rgya rnams kyang bris te de nas dbus su 'dug par bya'o //
translated: Having filled in the lines with colors in that way, and having drawn the seals, one should then sit in the center.

original: su zhig ce na rdo rje slob dpon no //
analyzed: su zhig ce na rdo rje slob dpon no //
translated: Who? The vajra master.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rnal 'byor la gnas te /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni rdo rje h'um mdzad kyi rnal 'byor la gnas te /
translated: Equanimous means abiding in the yoga of Vajradhara.

original: yid kyis khang pa brtsegs ma mngon sum du dmigs la de'i yang rdo rje'i sgo bzhi dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyis khang pa brtsegs ma mngon sum du dmigs la de'i yang rdo rje'i sgo bzhi dbye bar bya'o //
translated: Visualize the mental mansion directly, and open the four vajra doors of that as well.

original: de nas 'og nas 'byung ba'i snying pos dam tshig rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas 'og nas 'byung ba'i snying pos dam tshig rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: Then, with the essence mantra that will be given below, one should set out the pledges.

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor 'di la ni bdag po bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor 'di la ni bdag po bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje yin pas bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' nyid kyis /
translated: In this maṇḍala of the wheel of the three worlds, the lord is Bhagavat Vajrapāṇi.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad des stobs kyis bkug ste /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad des stobs kyis bkug ste /
translated: Then, all the tathāgatas are summoned by his power,

original: gzi brjid phung po'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi spyi bor dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: gzi brjid phung po'i gzugs kyi rang bzhin gyi spyi bor dbang bskur ro //
translated: and they confer empowerment on the crown of his form, which is a mass of splendor.

original: de rnams kyang gzhan dbang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyang gzhan dbang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that they are also under his control,

original: gdan pha gu zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gdan pha gu zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the lion seat,”

original: ji ltar rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor du seng ge'i gdan gsungs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor du seng ge'i gdan gsungs pa bzhin du /
translated: just as the lion seat is taught in the maṇḍala of the vajra realm.

original: de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyi rdzu 'phrul che ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang ngo bo nyid kyi rdzu 'phrul che ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they are also naturally of great magic power,

original: gser ram yang na dngul zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gser ram yang na dngul zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Or else, gold or silver.

original: de ni ji ltar bris pa'i lha rnams bzhag pa de dag gis dgod pa'i snying po ston te /
analyzed: de ni ji ltar bris pa'i lha rnams bzhag pa de dag gis dgod pa'i snying po ston te /
translated: This is the essence of the laughter of those deities as they are drawn.

original: snga ma ni bzlas pa'i sngags su gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni bzlas pa'i sngags su gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The former is said to be the mantra for recitation.🔽Thus, the Blessed Buddhas have taught the essence of laughter.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgod pa'i snying po gsungs nas de nyid kyi phyogs bzhir bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal bar mdzad cing bzhugs so //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dgod pa'i snying po gsungs nas de nyid kyi phyogs bzhir bcom ldan 'das phyag na rdo rje 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal bar mdzad cing bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed One Vajrapāṇi, having conquered the three worlds, resides in the four directions of that [maṇḍala].

original: de bas na de'i spyan snga nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de bas na de'i spyan snga nas brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, beginning from his presence,

original: snying po bzhi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snying po bzhi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: the four essences should be known in sequence.

original: rdo rje shugs ni shin tu grags par zad do //
analyzed: rdo rje shugs ni shin tu grags par zad do //
translated: The vajra speed is well known.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa rgal nas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi spyan snga'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa rgal nas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi spyan snga'i dkyil 'khor gang yin pa ste /
translated: Having crossed over the second maṇḍala means the maṇḍala in front of the Blessed Vairocana.

original: der dbus su rdo rje bzhag la rdo rje sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhi bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: der dbus su rdo rje bzhag la rdo rje sgyu ma la sogs pa bzhi bri bar bya'o //
translated: There, in the center, having placed a vajra, one should draw the four, Vajramāyā, etc.

original: bri zhes smos su zin gyis kyang bzhag pa nyid du rig par bya ste gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor 'di nyid sngar bris zin kyang /
analyzed: bri zhes smos su zin gyis kyang bzhag pa nyid du rig par bya ste gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor 'di nyid sngar bris zin kyang /
translated: Although it is said “draw,” one should understand “place,” because although this very maṇḍala was drawn previously,

original: bri bar bya zhes bya ba'i tshig de sngar ma gsungs pa'i @6b phyir ro //
analyzed: bri bar bya zhes bya ba'i tshig de sngar ma gsungs pa'i @6b phyir ro //
translated: the word “draw” was not stated previously.

original: yang na snga ma'i thig gi rjes tshon gyis dgang zhes gsungs pas 'khor lo'i dbyibs su khang pa brtsegs ma bris te /
analyzed: yang na snga ma'i thig gi rjes tshon gyis dgang zhes gsungs pas 'khor lo'i dbyibs su khang pa brtsegs ma bris te /
translated: Or else, having filled in the previous lines with color, one should draw the multistoried palace in the shape of a wheel.

original: rim pa gsum du re re zhing sgo bzhi bya la /
analyzed: rim pa gsum du re re zhing sgo bzhi bya la /
translated: In three stages, one should make four doors in each.

original: der sgo dbye ba byas nas phyag rgya bri ba dang lha bri ba la bya'o /
analyzed: der sgo dbye ba byas nas phyag rgya bri ba dang lha bri ba la bya'o /
translated: Having opened the doors there, one should draw the seals and the deities.

original: rim pa 'di nyid du lho sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje bzhag la /
analyzed: rim pa 'di nyid du lho sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje bzhag la /
translated: In this very stage, in the center of the maṇḍala directly in front of the southern door, having placed a vajra,

original: rdo rje 'khyil pa la sogs pa rdo rje khro bo gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'khyil pa la sogs pa rdo rje khro bo gzhag par bya'o //
translated: one should place the vajra wrathful ones, Vajra-Aṅkuśa, etc.

original: de nas rim pa gnyis pa de nyid kyi shar nas brtsams te sgo bzhir rdo rje glang sna la sogs pa thams cad rim pa ji lta ba bzhin bri'o //
analyzed: de nas rim pa gnyis pa de nyid kyi shar nas brtsams te sgo bzhir rdo rje glang sna la sogs pa thams cad rim pa ji lta ba bzhin bri'o //
translated: Then, beginning from the east of that second tier, one should draw all of the four doors, beginning with the vajra elephant.

original: rim pa de nyid kyi nub sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje bzhag la /
analyzed: rim pa de nyid kyi nub sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje bzhag la /
translated: In the center of the maṇḍala in front of the western door of that tier, one should place the vajra.

original: rdo rje gtum po la sogs pa bzhi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bri'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gtum po la sogs pa bzhi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bri'o //
translated: One should draw the four, beginning with the vajra Caṇḍa.

original: rim pa de nyid kyi byang sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor du snga ma bzhin du dbus su rdo rje bzhag la rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa bran bzhi ltag 'og gi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bri'o //
analyzed: rim pa de nyid kyi byang sgo'i thad ka'i dkyil 'khor du snga ma bzhin du dbus su rdo rje bzhag la rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa bran bzhi ltag 'og gi rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du bri'o //
translated: In the maṇḍala in front of the northern door of that tier, one should place the vajra as before, and one should draw the four servants, beginning with the vajra hook, in the order of their names.

original: da ni rim pa gsum par gang zhig bri ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor bzhag pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: da ni rim pa gsum par gang zhig bri ba de bstan par bya ba'i phyir phyi rol gyi dkyil 'khor bzhag pa ni zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Now, in order to teach what should be drawn in the third tier, [the master] says, “the outer maṇḍala is placed,” and so forth.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi gnas su'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi phyi rol gyi gnas su'o //
translated: In the outer place of the maṇḍala.

original: ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni lha chen po la sogs pa rang rang gi chung ma rnams kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / mtshan ma dang / rgyan ci dang ci 'dra ba de dang de lta bur bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni lha chen po la sogs pa rang rang gi chung ma rnams kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / mtshan ma dang / rgyan ci dang ci 'dra ba de dang de lta bur bri bar bya'o //
translated: Just as they are means that one should draw the individual wives of Maheśvara and so forth, with their respective colors, shapes, signs, and ornaments.

original: ltag 'og go rims zhes bya ba ni lha chen po la sogs pa lha rnams go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ma mo thams cad bri bar bya ste 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor du bstan pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang
analyzed: ltag 'og go rims zhes bya ba ni lha chen po la sogs pa lha rnams go rims ji lta ba bzhin du ma mo thams cad bri bar bya ste 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor du bstan pa'i sngags dang phyag rgya dang
translated: The order is that all the mātṛkā deities should be drawn in the order of the deities, beginning with Maheśvara, and endowed with the mantras, mudrās, and so forth taught in the root maṇḍala of Trilokavijaya.

original: ldan par rim pa gsum par bskor te /
analyzed: ldan par rim pa gsum par bskor te /
translated: They should be drawn in the third enclosure,

original: bkod pa'i rim pa bzhin du bri bar bya'o //🔽rdo rje sgo ni thams cad du //
analyzed: bkod pa'i rim pa bzhin du bri bar bya'o // rdo rje sgo ni thams cad du //
translated: in the order of arrangement.

original: zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rnams su'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rnams su'o //
translated: The vajra doors are the doors of the root maṇḍala.

original: sgo srung rnams kyang de nyid do //
analyzed: sgo srung rnams kyang de nyid do //
translated: The door guardians are also there.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa de dag nyid de'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rnams su yang de nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa de dag nyid de'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor gyi sgo rnams su yang de nyid yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: These are the very same supramundane ones, and they should be known as the very same ones at the doors of the outer mandala.

original: cho ga rgyas pa ji bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga rgyas pa ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: Just as in the extensive ritual.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dir slob dpon gyi las dang / bka' nod pa la sogs pa rnams ji skad smos pa bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dir slob dpon gyi las dang / bka' nod pa la sogs pa rnams ji skad smos pa bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Here, the master's duties and the duties of the disciples, etc., are summarized as stated.

original: dgug pa la sogs pa'i las kun byas te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgug pa la sogs pa'i las kun byas te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Having performed all the rites of summoning, etc.

original: dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba dang / phyag rgya rnam pa gsum bcing ba dang / mchod pa dang / bshos dang / gtor ma dbul ba la sogs pa thams cad bsdu'o //
analyzed: dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang / bcing ba dang / dbang du bya ba dang / phyag rgya rnam pa gsum bcing ba dang / mchod pa dang / bshos dang / gtor ma dbul ba la sogs pa thams cad bsdu'o //
translated: This summarizes all the rites of summoning, inducting, binding, controlling, binding the three kinds of seals, worship, offering of food, offering of sacrificial cakes, and so on.

original: rdo rje rnams kyi dam tshig ni phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje rnams kyi dam tshig ni phyag rgya dang dkyil 'khor la sogs pa ste /
translated: The commitment of the vajras is the seals, the mandalas, etc.

original: de dag gi ye shes yin pas na @7a * //
analyzed: de dag gi ye shes yin pas na @7a * //
translated: Since it is the intuition of those,

original: rdo rje dam tshig gi ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje dam tshig gi ye shes so //
translated: it is the intuition of the vajra commitment.

original: bskyed par byas /
analyzed: bskyed par byas /
translated: One should generate.

original: de khyod kyis su la yang ma smra shig ces bya ba ni sngags sgrub pa'i phyir dam tshig bsrung ba la gus par bya ba ston to //
analyzed: de khyod kyis su la yang ma smra shig ces bya ba ni sngags sgrub pa'i phyir dam tshig bsrung ba la gus par bya ba ston to //
translated: Do not speak of this to anyone shows respect for the vow to be guarded for the sake of accomplishing the mantra.

original: ma bsrungs na sngags mi 'grub pa 'ba' zhig du ma zad kyi /
analyzed: ma bsrungs na sngags mi 'grub pa 'ba' zhig du ma zad kyi /
translated: If it is not guarded, not only is the mantra not accomplished,

original: mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes pa dang / 'jig rten phyi ma'i nyes par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes pa dang / 'jig rten phyi ma'i nyes par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: but there is also a fault in the present life and a fault in the next world.

original: de la mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes pa ni dus ma yin par 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes pa ni dus ma yin par 'chi ba'o //
translated: Among them, the fault in the present life is untimely death.

original: 'jig rten phyi ma'i nyes pa ni ngan song du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten phyi ma'i nyes pa ni ngan song du 'gro ba'o //
translated: The fault in the next world is going to the lower realms.

original: de ltar dam bcas pa la bkod cing nyes dmigs bstan nas mna'i snying po sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dam bcas pa la bkod cing nyes dmigs bstan nas mna'i snying po sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having thus established the vow and shown the faults, the essence of the vow should be given.

original: dam tshig bsrung ba brtan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: dam tshig bsrung ba brtan par bya ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: In order to make firm the guarding of the vow,

original: khro bo ti rin ti ri'i phyag rgya yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: khro bo ti rin ti ri'i phyag rgya yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: the mudra of Krodha-Tirintirī should also be shown.

original: mna'i snying po las 'das par gyur na yang mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes dmigs rigs rnams zad pa dang / lus 'jig pa rnams bstan par bya ba ste /
analyzed: mna'i snying po las 'das par gyur na yang mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes dmigs rigs rnams zad pa dang / lus 'jig pa rnams bstan par bya ba ste /
translated: If one transgresses the oath, the faults of the present life will be exhausted, and the destruction of the body will be shown.

original: rdo rje 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mna'i snying po ston to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mna'i snying po ston to //
translated: The vajra oath and so forth shows the oath.

original: dam tshig bcings pa'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje khro bo ti rin ti ri'i phyag rgya bcing ba'i snying po'o //
analyzed: dam tshig bcings pa'o zhes bya ba ni rdo rje khro bo ti rin ti ri'i phyag rgya bcing ba'i snying po'o //
translated: The oath-bond is the essence of the Vajra Wrathful One's mudra-bond.

original: de ltar dam tshig bsrung ba'i phyir mna' bsgags nas /
analyzed: de ltar dam tshig bsrung ba'i phyir mna' bsgags nas /
translated: Thus, having sworn the oath for the sake of guarding the pledge,

original: de ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcing ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas rdo rje 'chang ba'i phyag rgya snying po 'dis bcing ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya bcing ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir de nas rdo rje 'chang ba'i phyag rgya snying po 'dis bcing ngo zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: then, in order to show the binding of the pledge seal, it is said, Then, bind the vajra-holding mudra with this essence.

original: de bcing ba'i snying po bstan nas mtshan nyid bstan pa ni mthe'u chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de bcing ba'i snying po bstan nas mtshan nyid bstan pa ni mthe'u chung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Having shown the essence of that binding, the characteristics are shown by the little finger and so forth.

original: lag pa g-yon pa mdun du kha sbubs te /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa mdun du kha sbubs te /
translated: The left hand is turned face-down in front.

original: thad dkar brkyang la de'i steng du lag pa g-yas pa bkan te brkyang nas bzhag ste lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung gis g-yas pa'i mthe bong bzung /
analyzed: thad dkar brkyang la de'i steng du lag pa g-yas pa bkan te brkyang nas bzhag ste lag pa g-yon pa'i mthe'u chung gis g-yas pa'i mthe bong bzung /
translated: Extend the arms straight out in front of the body. Extend the right arm straight out and place it on top of the left arm.🔽

original: g-yon pa'i mthe bos kyang g-yas pa'i mthe'u chung bzung la /
analyzed: g-yon pa'i mthe bos kyang g-yas pa'i mthe'u chung bzung la /
translated: Extend the right arm straight out above the head, and place the left hand on the right hand, with the little finger of the left hand holding the thumb of the right hand.🔽With the left hand, hold the right hand in this way, with the little finger and thumb crossed.

original: de ltar mthe'u chung dang / mthe bong sbrel pa'i lag pa gnyis ni bla 'og tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mthe'u chung dang / mthe bong sbrel pa'i lag pa gnyis ni bla 'og tu 'gyur te /
translated: The two hands are thus crossed above and below.

original: 'di ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i phyag rgya yin no //
translated: This is the mudra of Vajradhara.

original: de nas rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje chus dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas rdo rjes byin gyis brlabs pa'i rdo rje chus dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Then, consecrate the vajra with the vajra water, and confer initiation.

original: dbang bskur ba 'di ni bsang gtor bya ba lta bu yin te gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor 'di ni phal chen 'jig rten gyi lhas byin gyis brlabs pa yin la /
analyzed: dbang bskur ba 'di ni bsang gtor bya ba lta bu yin te gang gi phyir dkyil 'khor 'di ni phal chen 'jig rten gyi lhas byin gyis brlabs pa yin la /
translated: This initiation is like a sprinkling, because this mandala is consecrated by the worldly gods.

original: gang phyi rol gyi gtsang sbra la dga' ba de dag gi phyir /
analyzed: gang phyi rol gyi gtsang sbra la dga' ba de dag gi phyir /
translated: For those who delight in external purity,

original: dbang bskur ba 'dis dag par byas la gzod gzhug par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba 'dis dag par byas la gzod gzhug par bya ba yin no //
translated: they are purified by this initiation and then should be admitted.

original: 'di ni mgo smos pa tsam du zad kyi de rnams kyi gzung ba'i cho ga lhag ma ni rdo rje dbyings las gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mgo smos pa tsam du zad kyi de rnams kyi gzung ba'i cho ga lhag ma ni rdo rje dbyings las gsungs pa'i cho ga bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: This is just a brief introduction; the remaining ritual for their retention should be understood according to the ritual taught in the Vajra Element.🔽Then, having removed the blindfold, etc.

original: de nas gdong g-yogs pa bkrol nas zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de nas gdong g-yogs pa bkrol nas zhes bya ba ni go sla'o //
translated: is easy to understand.
