translated: Now, in order to demonstrate praise from the perspective of Amitābha,

original: sangs rgyas sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “buddha, bodhisattva,” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems dpa' yin pas na sangs rgyas sems pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis byin gyis brlabs pa'i sems dpa' yin pas na sangs rgyas sems pa'o //
translated: Since he is a bodhisattva blessed by the Buddha, he is a buddha bodhisattva.

original: sems dpa' bzang pa yin pas na sems bzang ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' bzang pa yin pas na sems bzang ste /
translated: Since he is a good bodhisattva, he is a good mind,

original: byang chub sems pa'i rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub sems pa'i rnams so //
translated: that is, a bodhisattva.

original: de rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa yin pas na sems bzang mchog go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pa yin pas na sems bzang mchog go //
translated: Since he is the best of those, he is the best good mind.

original: 'od dpag tu med pas yongs su bzung ba nyid kyis na chos nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir chos kyi sems dpa'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pas yongs su bzung ba nyid kyis na chos nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir chos kyi sems dpa'o //
translated: Since he is completely taken hold of by Amitābha, he is a dharma bodhisattva, because he realizes reality.

original: sems dpa' bzang po yin pas na sems mchog ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' bzang po yin pas na sems mchog ste /
translated: Since he is a good bodhisattva, he is a supreme mind,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis dag pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he realizes that all phenomena are pure by nature.

original: sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsam pa la bya bar bshad la /
analyzed: sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i sgra ni bsam pa la bya bar bshad la /
translated: The term “bodhisattva” is explained as referring to an intention.

original: de lta bu'i bsam pa 'dzin pas na sems chog 'dzin ces bshad do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam pa 'dzin pas na sems chog 'dzin ces bshad do //
translated: Since he holds such an intention, he is explained as “holding the supreme mind.”

original: sems dpa' rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pas na sems dpa'i dam pa ste /
analyzed: sems dpa' rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pas na sems dpa'i dam pa ste /
translated: Since he is the most excellent of all beings, he is the Best of Beings.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mchog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽shin tu yang can rnams mkhyen pas na sems mchog shes so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis mchog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro // shin tu yang can rnams mkhyen pas na sems mchog shes so //
translated: He is the most excellent by virtue of his own nature.🔽Since he knows the most excellent minds, he is the Knower of the Best Minds.

original: yang na sems dpa' mchog rnams mkhyen pas na sems pa'i mchog shes so //
analyzed: yang na sems dpa' mchog rnams mkhyen pas na sems pa'i mchog shes so //
translated: Or, since he knows the most excellent beings, he is the Knower of the Best Beings.

original: 'khor bar chags pas na sems can te /
analyzed: 'khor bar chags pas na sems can te /
translated: Beings are those who are attached to cyclic existence,

original: sdug bsngal rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams so //
translated: to suffering.

original: de rnams la rje su thugs brtse bas 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las bskyab par bya ba'i phyir chags par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams la rje su thugs brtse bas 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las bskyab par bya ba'i phyir chags par mdzad pa ste /
translated: Out of his great compassion for them, he is attached to them in order to protect them from the eight great fears.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na sems can dpa' zhes bshad do //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na sems can dpa' zhes bshad do //
translated: In the manner of an etymological explanation, he is called the Hero of Beings.

original: tshig su bcad pa 'di yang mtshan bdun gyis bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig su bcad pa 'di yang mtshan bdun gyis bstod pa yin no //
translated: This verse is also a praise with seven epithets.

original: da ni phyag rgya chen pa'i sgo nas bstod pa bstan pa'i phyir spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni phyag rgya chen pa'i sgo nas bstod pa bstan pa'i phyir spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach the praise by way of the great seal, he says Avalokitesvara, etc.

original: @26a * // spyan ras gzigs kyis 'tsho bas na na spyan ras gzigs so //
analyzed: @26a * // spyan ras gzigs kyis 'tsho bas na na spyan ras gzigs so //
translated: Avalokita means he looks with compassion.

original: spyan ras gzigs pa la mnga' brnyes pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang ste /
analyzed: spyan ras gzigs pa la mnga' brnyes pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang ste /
translated: Avalokitesvara means he is the lord of compassion.

original: rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dag pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid thugs su chud pa la mnga' brnyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the lord of compassion because he has attained mastery over the realization of the reality of the pure nature of things.

original: mgon po ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
analyzed: mgon po ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te /
translated: The lords are the Tathagatas.

original: de rnams kyi sras kyi mchog yin pas na mgon po mchog go //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sras kyi mchog yin pas na mgon po mchog go //
translated: He is the best of their sons, thus he is the best of lords.

original: yang na mgon po ni phongs pa rnams las skyob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang na mgon po ni phongs pa rnams las skyob par byed pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the lords are those who protect those in distress.🔽He is the best of the lords because he is the protector of those seized by the eight

original: 'jigs pa chen po brgyad kyi zin pa rnams las yongs su skyob par mdzad pas na mgon po rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pas na mgon po'i mchog go //
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po brgyad kyi zin pa rnams las yongs su skyob par mdzad pas na mgon po rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pas na mgon po'i mchog go //
translated: great fears.

original: mgon po yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na mgon po chen po ste /
analyzed: mgon po yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na mgon po chen po ste /
translated: He is the great lord because he is the lord and great.

original: gdul bya'i don gyi bya ba chen po la brtson par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya'i don gyi bya ba chen po la brtson par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the great lord because he is engaged in the great deeds of benefiting those to be trained.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis khyad par du rnam par gzigs pas na rnam gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis khyad par du rnam par gzigs pas na rnam gzigs pa'o //
translated: Since all Buddhas see it in particular, it is the seen.

original: ye shes kyi snang ba shin tu yang 'phel bar gyur bas na snang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba shin tu yang 'phel bar gyur bas na snang ba'o //
translated: Since the light of intuition increases greatly, it is the light.

original: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na 'jig rten no //
analyzed: sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na 'jig rten no //
translated: Since it has the nature of the world of sentient beings and the world of their environment, it is the world.

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi don mdzad pas na 'jig rten don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi don mdzad pas na 'jig rten don to //
translated: Since it acts for the sake of the world, it is the world's aim.

original: 'jig rten mgon khyod ces bya ba ni mtshan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon khyod ces bya ba ni mtshan te /
translated: You, O Protector of the World, is the name.

original: de bas na mtshan des mtshon par byas te bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan des mtshon par byas te bstod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is praised by being characterized by that name.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i 'di ni mtshan brgyad kyis bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i 'di ni mtshan brgyad kyis bstod pa yin no //
translated: This verse is a praise with eight names.

original: da ni chos kyi phyag rgya'i sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir 'jig rten yi ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi phyag rgya'i sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir 'jig rten yi ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to praise by way of the seal of the Dharma, he says the world's letters, etc.

original: 'jig rten du mi 'gyur bas na yi ge ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten du mi 'gyur bas na yi ge ste /
translated: Since it does not change in the world, it is a letter.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is conception.

original: yang na mi 'gyur bas na yi ge ste /
analyzed: yang na mi 'gyur bas na yi ge ste /
translated: Or, since it does not change, it is a letter.

original: gang chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni ngo bo nyid las mi 'gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi chos nyid ni ngo bo nyid las mi 'gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the reality of phenomena does not change from its intrinsic reality.

original: yi ge yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na yi ge chen po ste /
analyzed: yi ge yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na yi ge chen po ste /
translated: It is a great syllable because it is a syllable and great.

original: chos thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it pervades all phenomena.🔽Whatever is held to be a syllable in the world, held to be unchanging, is held to be permanent.

original: 'jig rten na yi ge ste mi 'gyur bar 'dod pa gang ci yang rung ba rtag par 'dod pa de rnams kyi mchog ste dam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten na yi ge ste mi 'gyur bar 'dod pa gang ci yang rung ba rtag par 'dod pa de rnams kyi mchog ste dam pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The supreme of those is the meaning of “ultimate.”

original: chos nyid kyi mchog yin pa'i mi 'gyur ba gang gis mtshungs par gyur bas yi ge ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste de dang mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni yi ge 'dra'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi mchog yin pa'i mi 'gyur ba gang gis mtshungs par gyur bas yi ge ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste de dang mtshungs pa gang yin pa de ni yi ge 'dra'o //
translated: The supreme of realities is unchanging. Since it is the same as that, the syllable is the Tathāgata. That which is the same as that is the syllable of the same.

original: mi 'gyur ba rnams kyi yang mi 'gyur pa @26b yin pas yi ge'i yi ge ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba rnams kyi yang mi 'gyur pa @26b yin pas yi ge'i yi ge ste /
translated: Since it is also unchanging of the unchangings, it is the syllable of the syllable.

original: mi 'gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The unchanging is the Tathāgata.

original: ye shes las sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes las sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: It is the essence of the nirmāṇakāya emanated body that is manifested from gnosis.

original: de rnams kyi chos kyi sku la lhag pa'i spyod par mdzad pas mi 'gyur ba'i yang mi 'gyur ba ni yi ge'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi chos kyi sku la lhag pa'i spyod par mdzad pas mi 'gyur ba'i yang mi 'gyur ba ni yi ge'i yi ge'o //
translated: The unchanging of the unchanging is the syllable of the syllables, because of the performance of the supreme conduct in the dharmakāya of those.

original: spyan lnga dang ldan pas na thams cad spyan te /
analyzed: spyan lnga dang ldan pas na thams cad spyan te /
translated: He is the all-seeing one, because he possesses the five eyes.

original: sh'i spyan dang ; lha dang / chos dang / shes rab dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad spyan no //
analyzed: sh'i spyan dang ; lha dang / chos dang / shes rab dang sangs rgyas kyi spyan dang ldan pa'i phyir thams cad spyan no //
translated: He is the all-seeing one, because he possesses the fleshly eye, the divine eye, the Dharma eye, the wisdom eye, and the buddha eye.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i yi ge'i 'khor lo'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba'i yi ge'i 'khor lo'i gzugs kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na /
translated: He is the wheel of syllables that arises from the noble perfection of wisdom, because he has the nature of the form of the wheel of syllables.

original: 'khor lo'i yi ge khyod phyag 'tshal //🔽zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i yi ge khyod phyag 'tshal // zhes bya ba ste //
translated: Homage to you, O Wheel Syllable!

original: 'dir yang mtshan bdun gyis bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mtshan bdun gyis bstod pa yin no //
translated: Here, too, there is praise with seven epithets.

original: da ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstod pa'i phyir phyag na padmo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni dam tshig gi phyag rgya'i sgo nas tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstod pa'i phyir phyag na padmo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to praise with this verse from the perspective of the pledge seal, [the Bhagavān] declares, “Padma in the hand,” and so on.

original: phyag na mtshan par gyur pa'i padma mnga' bas na phyag na padmo'o //
analyzed: phyag na mtshan par gyur pa'i padma mnga' bas na phyag na padmo'o //
translated: He is the one with a lotus as a sign in the hand, because he possesses a lotus in the hand.

original: phyag chen po mnga' bas na phyag chen po ste gdul bya rnams kyi dgos pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir khyab bdag nyid du gyur par ston pa'i tshe /
analyzed: phyag chen po mnga' bas na phyag chen po ste gdul bya rnams kyi dgos pa yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir khyab bdag nyid du gyur par ston pa'i tshe /
translated: Because he has great hands, he is the one with great hands. When he teaches that he is the all-pervading lord in order to fulfill the needs of those to be tamed,🔽

original: phyag gi mthil gyis 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa 'gebs par mdzad pa'i phyir phyag chen po'o //
analyzed: phyag gi mthil gyis 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med pa 'gebs par mdzad pa'i phyir phyag chen po'o //
translated: He is the Great Hand because he has the great hand. When he teaches that he is the all-pervading lord in order to fulfill the needs of those to be trained, he is the Great Hand because he covers the innumerable world systems with the palm of his hand.

original: 'jigs pa chen po brgyad kyis skrag par gyur pa rnams la mi 'jigs pa spyin pa'i phyag gis dbugs 'byin par mdzad pas na dbugs 'bying pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po brgyad kyis skrag par gyur pa rnams la mi 'jigs pa spyin pa'i phyag gis dbugs 'byin par mdzad pas na dbugs 'bying pa'o //
translated: He is the Giver of Breath because he gives breath with the hand that gives fearlessness to those who are frightened by the eight great fears.

original: mchog sbyin pa'i phyag gis yi dags rnams kyi khar bdun rtsi la sogs pa stsol bar mdzad pas na spyin pa po'o //
analyzed: mchog sbyin pa'i phyag gis yi dags rnams kyi khar bdun rtsi la sogs pa stsol bar mdzad pas na spyin pa po'o //
translated: He is the Giver because he gives nectar, etc. with the hand that gives the highest gift to the hungry ghosts.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos 'phags ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mdo sde rnams yang dag par bsdus pa la 'jug par mdzad pas na sangs rgyas chos so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos 'phags ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa mdo sde rnams yang dag par bsdus pa la 'jug par mdzad pas na sangs rgyas chos so //
translated: He is the Buddha Dharma because he engages in the perfect compilation of the sutras, such as the noble perfection of wisdom of the buddhas.

original: 'di la sangs rgyas chen po mnga' bas na sangs rgyas chen po ste /
analyzed: 'di la sangs rgyas chen po mnga' bas na sangs rgyas chen po ste /
translated: He is a great buddha because he possesses the great buddhas.

original: dbu la sangs rgyas 'od dpag tu med pa 'jog par mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rdul phra rab las bsgrubs pa yin pas na sangs rgyas che'o //
analyzed: dbu la sangs rgyas 'od dpag tu med pa 'jog par mdzad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rdul phra rab las bsgrubs pa yin pas na sangs rgyas che'o //
translated: He is a great buddha because he is placed on the head of the Buddha Amitābha, and because he is accomplished from the atoms of the buddhas.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su sangs rgyas kyi skur bzhugs pas na sangs rgyas bdag nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su sangs rgyas kyi skur bzhugs pas na sangs rgyas bdag nyid do //
translated: He is the nature of the buddhas because he resides in the body of the Buddha in the place of Vajrasattva.

original: 'dir yang mtshan bdun gyis bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mtshan bdun gyis bstod pa yin no //
translated: Here also, he is praised with seven epithets.

original: da ni gzugs kyi sku'i sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sangs rgyas @27a * //
analyzed: da ni gzugs kyi sku'i sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas gzugs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / sangs rgyas @27a * //
translated: Now, in order to praise him from the point of view of his form body, he says the form of the buddhas, etc.

original: rnams kyi gzugs ni sangs rgyas gzugs te //🔽sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnams kyi gzugs ni sangs rgyas gzugs te // sangs rgyas kyis 'dul ba'i sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The form of the buddhas is the form of the buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pas bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi sprul pas bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the emanations of the buddhas reside in order to tame those sentient beings who are to be tamed by the buddhas.

original: de nyid kyis khams thams cad du khyab par phyir na gzugs chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis khams thams cad du khyab par phyir na gzugs chen po'o //
translated: Because of that, he is the great form because he pervades all the realms.

original: phyag na rdo rje'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pas nas rdo rje'i gzugs so //
analyzed: phyag na rdo rje'i gzugs kyis bzhugs pas nas rdo rje'i gzugs so //
translated: He is the form of Vajrapani, therefore he is the form of Vajrapani.

original: gzugs bzang po 'dzin par mdzad pas na gzugs bzang 'chang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs bzang po 'dzin par mdzad pas na gzugs bzang 'chang ngo //
translated: He holds the form of the good, therefore he is the holder of the good form.

original: chos rnams kyi snang ba mdzad pas na chos kyi snang ba ste snang ba ye shes la bya'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi snang ba mdzad pas na chos kyi snang ba ste snang ba ye shes la bya'o //
translated: He is the light of the Dharma, therefore he is the light of the Dharma. Light is to be understood as knowledge.

original: gang la gzi brjid bzang po mnga' ba de ni gzi brjid do //
analyzed: gang la gzi brjid bzang po mnga' ba de ni gzi brjid do //
translated: He who has the good splendor is the splendor.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni rdo rje nyi ma yin la //
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni rdo rje nyi ma yin la //
translated: The best of those is the Vajra Sun.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyis bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyis bzhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the best of the best, because he is the best of the best.🔽He is the best of the best, because he is the best of the best.

original: 'jig rten rnams la phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston pas snang bar mdzad pa'i phyir 'jig rten snang ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la phyin ci ma log pa'i chos ston pas snang bar mdzad pa'i phyir 'jig rten snang ba'o //
translated: He is the light of the world, because he illuminates the world with the unerring teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'dir yang mtshan bdun po nyid kyis bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mtshan bdun po nyid kyis bstod pa yin no //
translated: Here also, the seven epithets are the praise.

original: da ni rigs kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir padmo'i dpal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni rigs kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir padmo'i dpal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to praise him by way of family, he says the glory of the lotus, etc.

original: padma'o rigs kyi dpal yin pas na padmo'i dpal te /
analyzed: padma'o rigs kyi dpal yin pas na padmo'i dpal te /
translated: The glory of the lotus is the glory of the family of the lotus.

original: chu'i dpal chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chu'i dpal chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The great glory of the water is the meaning of the great glory of the water.

original: de'i mgon po yin pas na padmo'i dpal gyi mgon po'o //
analyzed: de'i mgon po yin pas na padmo'i dpal gyi mgon po'o //
translated: Since he is the protector of that, he is the protector of the glory of the lotus.

original: mgon po yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na mgon po mchog ste /
analyzed: mgon po yang yin la mchog kyang yin pas na mgon po mchog ste /
translated: Since he is a protector and also supreme, he is the supreme protector.

original: rigs pa'i rgyal po gzhan rnams kyi nang na mchog yin pa'i phyir mgon po mchog go //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rgyal po gzhan rnams kyi nang na mchog yin pa'i phyir mgon po mchog go //
translated: Since he is the supreme among the kings of reason, he is the supreme protector.

original: chos rnams kyi dpal yin pas na chos dpal ste lha mo dbyangs can no //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi dpal yin pas na chos dpal ste lha mo dbyangs can no //
translated: Since she is the glory of the Dharma, she is the goddess Sarasvatī, the glory of the Dharma.

original: de'i mgon po ni bdag por gyur pa ste des na chos dpal mgon po'o //
analyzed: de'i mgon po ni bdag por gyur pa ste des na chos dpal mgon po'o //
translated: Since he is the lord of her, he is the protector of the glory of the Dharma.

original: 'di la mgon po mnga' bas na mgon ldan te /
analyzed: 'di la mgon po mnga' bas na mgon ldan te /
translated: Since he possesses a protector, he is the one with a protector.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he possesses Amitābha.

original: tshangs pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i don te 'di'i mgon po mnga' bas na tshangs pa'i mgon po'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i don te 'di'i mgon po mnga' bas na tshangs pa'i mgon po'o //

original: tshangs pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na tshangs pa chen po ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na tshangs pa chen po ste /
translated: Since he is Brahmā and also great, he is the great Brahmā.

original: gdul bya rnams kyi dbang gis tshangs pa'i gzugs su sprul pa mdzad pas na tshangs pa chen po'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi dbang gis tshangs pa'i gzugs su sprul pa mdzad pas na tshangs pa chen po'o //
translated: He is the Great Brahma because he emanates in the form of Brahma in accordance with the faculties of those to be trained.

original: tshangs pa'i sras yin pas na tshangs sras te sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i sras yin pas na tshangs sras te sangs rgyas kyi sras zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He is the Son of Brahma because he is the son of Brahma, which means that he is the Son of the Buddha.

original: 'dir yang mtshan bdun gyis bstod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang mtshan bdun gyis bstod pa yin no //

analyzed: da ni ye shes kyi sgo nas bstod pa'i phyir snang ba'i snang mchog nges bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

original: mar med dang 'dra bas na snang ba snye /
analyzed: mar med dang 'dra bas na snang ba snye /
translated: He is the light of light because he is like a lamp.

analyzed: @27b phyi dang nang du bcas pa'i mun bsel bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: pa rnams kyi nga na yang chen por gyur pas na thub pa chen po'o //🔽de la lus thub pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa mi dge ba gsum las ldog pa'o //
translated: The great sage is the

original: ngag thub pa ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bzhi las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: ngag thub pa ni brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i mi dge ba'i las kyi lam bzhi las ldog pa'o //
translated: Speech restraint is turning away from the four unwholesome courses of action, such as lying.

original: yid thub pa ni log par lta ba la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gsum las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: yid thub pa ni log par lta ba la sogs pa mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gsum las ldog pa'o //
translated: Mind restraint is turning away from the three unwholesome courses of action, such as wrong view.

original: bshad par gsol zhes bya ba ni bstan par gsol zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshad par gsol zhes bya ba ni bstan par gsol zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Please explain means please teach.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs su lhan cig bzhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsol ba btab pa dang / bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpa' 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs su lhan cig bzhugs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the request having been made by the Tathagatas, the Blessed Vajrasattva, dwelling in the form of Lokeśvara,

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa ga la ba der mngon sum du phyogs par 'dug nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab tu zin kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa ga la ba der mngon sum du phyogs par 'dug nas zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis gsol ba btab tu zin kyang /
translated: approached the Blessed Śākyamuni Tathāgata and sat to one side means that even though the request was made by all the Tathāgatas,

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'ba' zhig la mngon du phyogs nas 'dug pa ni yang dag par byang chub pa dang // nye ba dang / de'i bstan pa la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir de la mngon du phyogs nas 'dug pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa 'ba' zhig la mngon du phyogs nas 'dug pa ni yang dag par byang chub pa dang // nye ba dang / de'i bstan pa la zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir de la mngon du phyogs nas 'dug pa yin no //
translated: They are seated facing the Blessed One, Śākyamuni, because they are close to perfect enlightenment and because they have entered his teaching.

original: rdo rje padmo de zhes bya ba ni rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rdo rje padmo de zhes bya ba ni rang gi dam tshig gi phyag rgya bstan pa yin no //
translated: The vajra lotus is the display of one’s pledge seal.

original: de yang dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i tshe na lag tu byin pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i tshe na lag tu byin pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the one that was placed in one’s hand when the maṇḍala was emanated.

original: rdo rjes mchan pa'i padma'i yin pas rdo rje padma'o //
analyzed: rdo rjes mchan pa'i padma'i yin pas rdo rje padma'o //
translated: It is a vajra lotus because it is a lotus marked with a vajra.

original: rang gi thugs kar bzhag ste /
analyzed: rang gi thugs kar bzhag ste /
translated: One should place it at one’s heart.

original: @29a * // zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir nyid kyi thugs kar bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: @29a * // zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par bya ba'i phyir nyid kyi thugs kar bzhag pa'o //
translated: In order to attain the samādhi of the emanation of the maṇḍala, one should place it at one’s heart.

original: ched du brjod pa ni ma dris par lung ston pa'o //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa ni ma dris par lung ston pa'o //
translated: The expression of amazement is the prediction without being asked.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: This is the one that is in one’s heart.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: Amazing! is a sense of wonder.

original: rab tu dag pa ni shin tu dag pa ste yid las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dag pa ni shin tu dag pa ste yid las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Very pure means extremely pure, because it is mental.

original: dag pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dag pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that purity?

original: rdo rje padmo 'di dag gi //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rdo rje padmo 'di dag gi // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: These vajra and lotus,

original: rdo rjes mtshan pa'i padmo ni rdo rje padmo'o //
analyzed: rdo rjes mtshan pa'i padmo ni rdo rje padmo'o //
translated: The vajra-marked lotus is the vajra lotus.

original: bdag gi pha yin zhes bya ba ni rdo rje padmo de las bdag skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag gi pha yin zhes bya ba ni rdo rje padmo de las bdag skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: The statement he is my father is because I was born from that vajra lotus.

original: bdag gi bu yang yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems gzugs med pa las rdo rje padmo 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi bu yang yin zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems gzugs med pa las rdo rje padmo 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement he is my son is because my formless mind arises from the vajra lotus.

original: de bas na bdag gi rigs 'og nas 'byung ba 'di byin gyis brlabs par mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag gi rigs 'og nas 'byung ba 'di byin gyis brlabs par mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, Bless this family lineage of mine that will arise later.

original: de ltar gang gi mthu bskyed pa'i phyir ched du brjod pa bstan pas na /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi mthu bskyed pa'i phyir ched du brjod pa bstan pas na /
translated: Thus, in order to generate his power, he teaches the exclamation.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa bskul ba yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa bskul ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān Śākyamuni is exhorted.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad ces bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: Then the Bhagavān Vairocana, etc.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
translated: There, then is the occasion.

original: skad la ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: skad la ba phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: The Bhagavān is so called because he is endowed with the perfection of speech.

original: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa nyid kyi gzi brjid yis zil gyis mnan nas rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ma lus pa nyid kyi gzi brjid yis zil gyis mnan nas rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Vairocana is so called because he is the illuminator who has overwhelmed the entire realm of sentient beings with his splendor.

original: dngos po rnams ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ji ltar gnas pa de bzhin du thugs su chud cing sangs rgyas pas na de bzhin gshegs pa ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is so called because he has realized and awakened to things just as they are.

original: 'gro ba'i don thams cad ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don thams cad ni shes pa'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the purpose of all beings is the purpose of knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de rnams dang 'brel ba'i rdo rje'i chos so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang yin la thams cad kyang yin pas na de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad de rnams dang 'brel ba'i rdo rje'i chos so //
translated: The vajra Dharma is connected with all the Tathāgatas, who are all the Tathāgatas.

original: de'i dam tshig ni snying po dang phyag rgyal sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dam tshig ni snying po dang phyag rgyal sogs pa'o //
translated: His commitment is the essence, the seal, and so forth.

original: de bsam pa'i khyad par gang las byung ba de byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bsam pa'i khyad par gang las byung ba de byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to bless that special thought from which it arises,

original: padma ltar gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la don dang mthun pa'i ming 'di skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: padma ltar gos pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de la don dang mthun pa'i ming 'di skad ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa de la snyoms par zhugs pa'o //
translated: The samādhi called Lotus Unsullied is the samādhi that has the name that corresponds to its meaning, and he entered into that samādhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig ces bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i snying po ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig ces bya ba ni 'og nas bshad pa'i snying po ste /
translated: The pledge of the Dharma of all the Tathāgatas is the essence explained below.

original: chos kyi dam tshig la nges par 'jug par nus pas na chos kyi dmar tshig ces bshad de de phyung ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dam tshig la nges par 'jug par nus pas na chos kyi dmar tshig ces bshad de de phyung ba'o //
translated: The pledge of the Dharma is explained as the ability to enter into the pledge of the Dharma, and it is drawn forth.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni thugs la gnas pa ste /
translated: This means that it abides in the mind.

original: rdo rje padmo'i phyag rgya dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i mthu bskyed pa'i phyir @29b 'jig rten dbang phyug gi thugs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje padmo'i phyag rgya dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i mthu bskyed pa'i phyir @29b 'jig rten dbang phyug gi thugs la gnas pa'o //
translated: Since it generates the power of emanation of the maṇḍala of the vajra lotus gesture, it abides in the mind of Lokeśvara.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs las zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i thugs las te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi thugs las zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i thugs las te /
translated: From the mind of all the Tathāgatas means from the mind of Akṣhobhya and so forth.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de dag kyang 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzugs su gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de dag kyang 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gzugs su gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and Akṣobhya, etc., are also placed in the form of the Subduer of the World.

original: kha dog ni ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: kha dog ni ser po dang dmar po la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Color is yellow, red, etc.

original: / gzugs ni dbyibs te ring po dang / thung du dang / gru bzhi dang / zlum po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: / gzugs ni dbyibs te ring po dang / thung du dang / gru bzhi dang / zlum po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Form is shape, long, short, square, round, etc.

original: rtags ni mtshan ma ste nor bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtags ni mtshan ma ste nor bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sign is mark, such as a jewel, etc.

original: spyod lam ni g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyod lam ni g-yo ba dang / 'gul ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Posture is movement, vibration, standing, walking, etc.

original: de lta bu'o 'od zer rnams byung nas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / chos nyid kyi ye shes yang dag par sbyangs nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul smin pa dang gro ba'i chags par chos nyid rnam par dag pa'i yes shes rab tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'o 'od zer rnams byung nas 'dod chags la sogs pa rnam par dag pa dang / chos nyid kyi ye shes yang dag par sbyangs nas zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul smin pa dang gro ba'i chags par chos nyid rnam par dag pa'i yes shes rab tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Having emitted such light-rays, they purify the objects of desire, etc., and the knowledge of reality, i.e., they purify the wisdom which is the purification of the objects of desire, etc., and the reality of purification.

original: sogs pa smos pa ni zhe snang dang gti mug la sogs pa yang rnam par rtog pas kun nas bslang zhing yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pa ni zhe snang dang gti mug la sogs pa yang rnam par rtog pas kun nas bslang zhing yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “and so on” refer to anger, delusion, and so on, because they also arise from the impetus of conceptualization and from unreal imagination.

original: don dam par ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, they are pure by their intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar ye shes dag par sbyangs nas /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes dag par sbyangs nas /
translated: Thus, having purified the gnosis in this way,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nas yang slar log ste dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i mthu bskyed pa'i phyir 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i thugs kar zhugs so zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul pa'i gzugs kyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad nas yang slar log ste dkyil 'khor sprul pa'i mthu bskyed pa'i phyir 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang po'i thugs kar zhugs so zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba 'dul pa'i gzugs kyi'o //
translated: he returns again from all the world-realms and enters into the heart of the noble Avalokiteśvara in order to generate the power of emanation of the maṇḍala. This is the form of the subjugation of beings.

original: da ni gtso bo lnga'i rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir sngags lnga bstan pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: da ni gtso bo lnga'i rang gi rigs kyi dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir sngags lnga bstan pa ni de nas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Now, in order to consecrate the maṇḍala of his own family of the five principal ones, the teaching of the five mantras should be understood, beginning with “Then the Blessed One . . .”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig ces pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi chos kyi dam tshig ces pa la /
translated: The pledge of the Dharma of all the Tathagatas.

original: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi chos dkyil 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig gi sngags ni chos kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi chos dkyil 'khor gyi de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig gi sngags ni chos kyi dam tshig go //
translated: The pledge mantra of the Dharma mandala of the Blessed Vairocana is the pledge of the Dharma of all the Tathagatas.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: da ni bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gzugs pa thams cad ston pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
analyzed: da ni bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gzugs pa thams cad ston pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs te /
translated: Now, the Blessed One, having entered the concentration called “The Display of All Forms,”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis nyid kyi thugs kar sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi byin gyi rlabs kyis nyid kyi thugs kar sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: through the blessing of the Blessed One, in order to explain the emanation mandala circle in his heart,

original: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags gsungs @30a * //🔽pa yin no //
analyzed: aom zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags gsungs @30a * // pa yin no //
translated: he uttered the mantra OṂ.

original: de nas de smras ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags kyi las ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas de smras ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngags kyi las ston pa yin no //
translated: Then, as soon as he said that, etc. teaches the activity of the mantra.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pa'i thugs las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa de nyid ces bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs kyi dbang pa'i thugs las bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa de nyid ces bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa' //
translated: The Blessed One, Vajradhara himself, from the heart of the noble Avalokitesvara, means Vajrasattva.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang po'i gzugs 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gi gzugs 'chang ba'o //
translated: Holding the form of the noble Avalokitesvara means assuming the form of Lokeśvara.

original: kha dog sna tshos pa ni sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog sna tshos pa ni sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Multicolored means blue, yellow, and so on.

original: gzugs ni dbyibs rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbyibs rnams so //
translated: Form means shapes.

original: cha lugs ni gos dang rgyan la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: cha lugs ni gos dang rgyan la sogs pa yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: Costume means garments, ornaments, and so on.

original: rgyan ni gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan ni gdu bu dang dpung rgyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Ornament means bracelets, armlets, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sems dpa' gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sems dpa' gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The beings who are Tathāgatas and so on are the Tathāgatas and so on.

original: de rnams kyi gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa sems dpa' thams cad kyi sku 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gzugs 'dzin par mdzad pas na de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa sems dpa' thams cad kyi sku 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Holding their forms means holding the bodies of all beings, such as the Tathāgatas and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas sems dpa' thams cad kyi sku bzung nas cir 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pas sems dpa' thams cad kyi sku bzung nas cir 'gyur zhe na //
translated: What happens when the Tathagatas and so on take hold of the bodies of all the Bodhisattvas?

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lus su gyur nas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' chen po'i lus su gyur nas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For that reason it is said, having become the body of the great Bodhisattva.

original: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi thugs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang phyug gi thugs las byung ba'o //
translated: He arises from the heart of Lokeśvara.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can ji ltar 'dul bar zhes bya ba ni sems can gang dang gang dag gzugs gang dang gang gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang de la de dang de'i gzugs su bstan pas 'dul bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sems can ji ltar 'dul bar zhes bya ba ni sems can gang dang gang dag gzugs gang dang gang gis 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dang de la de dang de'i gzugs su bstan pas 'dul bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: As for in all the world systems, in whatever way sentient beings are to be disciplined, sentient beings are disciplined by the display of whatever forms are necessary to discipline whatever sentient beings in whatever way is necessary to discipline them.

original: gdul ba byas te zhes bya ba ni bstan pa la btsud pa'o //
analyzed: gdul ba byas te zhes bya ba ni bstan pa la btsud pa'o //
translated: Having disciplined them means having introduced them to the teaching.

original: rim pas 'dis sems can gyi khams lus par gdul bar bya ste /
analyzed: rim pas 'dis sems can gyi khams lus par gdul bar bya ste /
translated: Having disciplined them in this way, he disciplines the remaining sentient beings in the realm of sentient beings in stages.

original: yang slar log nas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por rnam par bkad pa'i tshul du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang slar log nas rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen po'i tshul du zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor chen por rnam par bkad pa'i tshul du gnas pa'o //
translated: Again, returning, in the manner of the great mandala of the Vajra Realm, means that they abide in the manner of the great mandala of the Vajra Realm being opened.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas na bzhugs pa de'i phyogs thams cad de phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas ched du brjod pa ni ched du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas na bzhugs pa de'i phyogs thams cad de phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la gnas nas ched du brjod pa ni ched du brjod pa'o //
translated: The Bhagavat Shakyamuni, dwelling in the place of Vairochana, in all directions, in the cardinal and intermediate directions, abiding in the lunar discs, the exclamation is the exclamation.

original: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ae ma'o zhes bya ba ni ngo mtshar du gyur pa'o //
translated: Emaho means astonishing!

original: ci zhig ngo mtshar che zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig ngo mtshar che zhe na /
translated: What is astonishing?🔽The method.

original: thabs so // su zhig gi zhe na /
analyzed: thabs so // su zhig gi zhe na /
translated: Of whom?

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi'o //
translated: Of all the buddhas.

original: ji ltar bu zhig gi zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bu zhig gi zhe na /
translated: How?

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The compassionate nature.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i myur du dka' ba med par thob par @30b byed pas na thabs te /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i myur du dka' ba med par thob par @30b byed pas na thabs te /
translated: It is a method because it quickly and effortlessly accomplishes the desired goal.

original: ye shes nyid kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig go //
analyzed: ye shes nyid kyi khyad par 'ga' zhig go //
translated: It is a special kind of wisdom.

original: de lta bu'i thabs kyi 'dul ba'i phyir gzugs gzhan dag tu yang ston te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i thabs kyi 'dul ba'i phyir gzugs gzhan dag tu yang ston te /
translated: For the sake of taming by such means, he also displays other forms.

original: gang gi phyir gang du thabs kyis 'dul bar mdzad na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang du thabs kyis 'dul bar mdzad na /
translated: For what reason?

original: lha rnams su yang 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ste /🔽'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi gzugs su yang ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams su yang 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ste / 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams kyi gzugs su yang ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He also becomes the gods.🔽He also displays the forms of worldly gods.

original: de yang gang dang gang gi gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: de yang gang dang gang gi gzugs kyis ni //
translated: And he also displays the forms of those to be tamed.🔽He displays the forms of those to be tamed,

original: lus can rnam par 'dul 'gyur ba //
analyzed: lus can rnam par 'dul 'gyur ba //
translated: in whatever forms will tame embodied beings.

original: thugs rjes non pa de dang der //
analyzed: thugs rjes non pa de dang der //
translated: The compassionate one, in whatever way,

original: brtse ba'i bdag nyid ston par mdzad //🔽ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: brtse ba'i bdag nyid ston par mdzad // ces ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: displays himself out of love.

original: rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho gar bsdus pa gang yin pa des rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas te /
analyzed: rgyud 'dir dkyil 'khor gyi slob dpon gyis dkyil 'khor bri ba'i cho gar bsdus pa gang yin pa des rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin la gnas te /
translated: As explained here, in this tantra, the maṇḍala master, in the ritual of drawing the maṇḍala, abiding in the samādhi of Vairocana,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: should gather all the buddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: In the tathāgata family, it is Śrī Vajrasattva.

original: rdo rje'i rigs su ni h'um mdzad do //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs su ni h'um mdzad do //
translated: In the vajra family, it is Hūṃkāra.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba la ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba la ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug go //
translated: For the conversion of beings, Avalokiteśvara.

original: don thams cad grub pa la ni nam mkha'i snying po ste /
analyzed: don thams cad grub pa la ni nam mkha'i snying po ste /
translated: For the accomplishment of all aims, Ākāśagarbha.

original: rang gi snying po thugs ka na gnas pa la rang gi mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi snying po thugs ka na gnas pa la rang gi mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad pas gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should supplicate with one’s own one hundred and eight names, which are located in one’s heart.

original: gsol ba btab nas dkyil 'khor gang du dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags des dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya'o// sngags gang dkyil 'khor mthu bskyed pa'i sngags des ni dkyil 'khor mthu bskyed par bya'o //🔽sngags gang dkyil 'khor gdon pa'i sngags des dkyil 'khor dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba btab nas dkyil 'khor gang du dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags des dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab par bya'o// sngags gang dkyil 'khor mthu bskyed pa'i sngags des ni dkyil 'khor mthu bskyed par bya'o // sngags gang dkyil 'khor gdon pa'i sngags des dkyil 'khor dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Having supplicated, one should consecrate the maṇḍala with the mantra for consecrating the maṇḍala in whatever maṇḍala. With the mantra for generating the power of the maṇḍala, one should generate the power of the maṇḍala.🔽With the mantra for removing the maṇḍala, one should remove the maṇḍala.🔽With the mantra for arranging the maṇḍala, one should arrange the maṇḍala.

original: sngags gang phyag rgya rnams dog dpar gsungs pa des phyag rgya rnams dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sngags gang phyag rgya rnams dog dpar gsungs pa des phyag rgya rnams dgod par bya'o //
translated: With the mantra for the mudrās, one should display the mudrās.

original: dkyil 'khor po 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis 'jig rten dbang phyug gi mthu bskyed pa'i phyir thob ma'i sngags gsungs so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor po 'dir ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyis 'jig rten dbang phyug gi mthu bskyed pa'i phyir thob ma'i sngags gsungs so //
translated: In this mandala, the Bhagavat Vairocana has taught the mantra of the Lord of the World in order to generate his power.

original: de nas gtso bo lngas rang rang gi dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir sngags lnga gsungs so /
analyzed: de nas gtso bo lngas rang rang gi dkyil 'khor byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir sngags lnga gsungs so /
translated: Then, the five principal ones have taught five mantras in order to consecrate their own mandalas.

original: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gi dkyil 'khor gdon pa'i phyir sngags gzhan gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug gi dkyil 'khor gdon pa'i phyir sngags gzhan gsungs so //
translated: After that, the Bhagavat has taught another mantra in order to place the mandala of the Lord of the World.

original: de nas sems can dpa' thams cad kyi dgod pa sngags gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas sems can dpa' thams cad kyi dgod pa sngags gsungs so //
translated: Then, he has taught the mantra of the placement of all the heroes.

original: de ltar byas na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas dang 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gnas su sngags gsum gsum du 'gyur la /🔽rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'do dpag tu med pa dang gnod mi za @31a * //
analyzed: de ltar byas na bcom ldan 'das rnam par snang mdzad kyi gnas dang 'gro ba 'dul ba'i gnas su sngags gsum gsum du 'gyur la / rin chen 'byung ldan dang 'do dpag tu med pa dang gnod mi za @31a * //
translated: If it is done in this way, there are three mantras each in the abode of the Bhagavat Vairocana and in the abode of the Lord of the World who subdues the world.

original: bar grub pa'i gnas su gnyis gnyis so //
analyzed: bar grub pa'i gnas su gnyis gnyis so //
translated: In the abode of the accomplishment of Ratnasaṃbhava, Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi, there are two each.

original: lhag ma rnams su ni dgod pa'i sngags re rer zad de 'di dag ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams su ni dgod pa'i sngags re rer zad de 'di dag ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The rest are exhausted in the mantras of the placement. These are the condensed meanings.

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs so //
translated: Then is the occasion.

original: byang chub sems dpas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas na byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is the bodhisattva.

original: dmyal ba'i gnas su yang padma bskyed par bya'o zhes dgongs pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i gnas su yang padma bskyed par bya'o zhes dgongs pas na sems dpa' chen po'o //
translated: The great being is the one who thinks, “I will generate the lotus in the abode of the hells.”

original: spyan ras kyis gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs te sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gzigs pa'i phyir spyan ras gzigs kyang yin la dbang po yang yin pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang po ste /
analyzed: spyan ras kyis gzigs pas na spyan ras gzigs te sangs rgyas thams cad kyis gzigs pa'i phyir spyan ras gzigs kyang yin la dbang po yang yin pas na spyan ras gzigs dbang po ste /
translated: Avalokita is the one who sees. Since he is seen by all buddhas, he is Avalokita. Since he is also an eye, he is Avalokiteśvara.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don rdzogs par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who completely fulfills the aims of all sentient beings.

original: rang gi rigs bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi dgos pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs par nus pa'i padmo'i rigs nyid kyi tshug ka nas sprul te /
analyzed: rang gi rigs bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni gdul bya rnams kyi dgos pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin du rdzogs par nus pa'i padmo'i rigs nyid kyi tshug ka nas sprul te /
translated: Having generated his own family means that he emanates the lotus family itself from his heart center, which is capable of fulfilling the aims of those to be tamed just as they are.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phul zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la phul zhes bya ba dang sbyor ro //
translated: One should connect this with offered to all the Tathagatas.

original: de'i ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can thams cad 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las mi 'jigs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / don thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / grub pa dam pa ni rdo rje chos nyid dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad 'jigs pa chen po brgyad las mi 'jigs pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / don thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / grub pa dam pa ni rdo rje chos nyid dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa ste /
translated: In order to attain the great fearlessness from the eight great fears of all sentient beings, and in order to attain the goal, the highest accomplishment is the reality of the vajra, the knowledge and the superknowledges.

original: rdo rje ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rnams so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i rnams so //
translated: The vajra is the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: de rnams kyi chos nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams kyi chos nyid ni sangs rgyas nyid dang byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: Their reality is Buddhahood and Bodhisattvahood.

original: ye shes ni don gyi yul thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'o /
analyzed: ye shes ni don gyi yul thams cad la sgrib pa med pa'o /
translated: Knowledge is the unobstructedness with regard to all objects of knowledge.

original: mngon par shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga tshe rab thams cad du 'byung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mngon par shes pa drug po rnams so //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa lnga tshe rab thams cad du 'byung ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi mngon par shes pa drug po rnams so //
translated: The superknowledges are the five superknowledges of the Bodhisattvas, which occur in all lives, and the six superknowledges of the Tathagatas.

original: de ltar na rdo rje chos nyid dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa ni rdo rje chos nyid dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rdo rje chos nyid dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa ni rdo rje chos nyid dang / ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the vajra nature, intuition, and higher perceptions are the vajra nature, intuition, and higher perceptions.

original: de nyid ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: That itself is the result,

original: de'i rgyu de rnyed pa'i phyir te de blo la nye bar gnas par ston to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de rnyed pa'i phyir te de blo la nye bar gnas par ston to //
translated: because the cause of that is attained, and it is taught that it abides in the mind.

original: ming ji skad du bya ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ming ji skad du bya ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is the name of that?

original: de'i phyir 'gro ba 'dul ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gro ba 'dul ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is called the Subjugation of the Three Worlds.

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'dis 'dul bar byed pas na de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'dis 'dul bar byed pas na de'i phyir 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Because all worlds are subjugated by this, therefore it is explained as the Subjugation of the Three Worlds.

original: dkyil 'khor ni snying po la bya ste phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i don yin la /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ni snying po la bya ste phyir mi ldog pa'i 'khor lo'i don yin la /
translated: The maṇḍala is the essence, the meaning of the irreversible wheel,

original: de len pas na dkyil 'khor ro /
analyzed: de len pas na dkyil 'khor ro /
translated: and because it takes that, it is the maṇḍala.

original: chen po 'dis 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dbang du byas pas so //
analyzed: chen po 'dis 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dbang du byas pas so //
translated: It is great because it is from the perspective of subjugating all worlds by this.

original: de bshad par bya ba ni de @31b bstan to zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad par bya ba ni de @31b bstan to zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That which is to be explained is taught.

original: ji ltar bshad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be explained?

original: de nas rab tu bshad par bya //
analyzed: de nas rab tu bshad par bya //
translated: Then it is to be explained.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said.🔽Then,

original: de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba ni rjes thogs la ste /
translated: means immediately after,

original: 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i rjes thogs la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum gyi 'khor lo'i rjes thogs la'o //
translated: immediately after the Wheel of the Three Worlds.

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga med par de dang 'brel pa'i dgos pa mi 'grub pas de'i phyir rab tu bshad par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'dul ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi cho ga med par de dang 'brel pa'i dgos pa mi 'grub pas de'i phyir rab tu bshad par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Since the purpose connected with that is not accomplished without the ritual of the mandala of the Subjugation of All Beings, therefore it is said, “I will fully explain, etc. ”

original: yang dag par rab tu bye ste bshad pas na rab tu bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu bye ste bshad pas na rab tu bshad pa'o //
translated: It is fully explained, fully taught, thus it is fully explained.

original: dkyil 'khor yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na dkyil 'khor chen po ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor yang yin la chen po yang yin pas na dkyil 'khor chen po ste /
translated: Since it is a mandala and also great, it is a great mandala.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor bgrang ba las 'das pas na dkyil 'khor chen po'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor bgrang ba las 'das pas na dkyil 'khor chen po'o //
translated: Since the mandala circle of buddhas and bodhisattvas is beyond count, it is a great mandala.

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba la gtso bor gyur pas na dam pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba la gtso bor gyur pas na dam pa'o //
translated: Since it is foremost in the subjugation of beings, it is supreme.🔽Like the Vajra Realm,

original: rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba rdo rje dbyings dang mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje dbyings dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba rdo rje dbyings dang mtshungs pa'o //
translated: means like the Vajra Realm.

original: mid ji skad bya zhe na /
analyzed: mid ji skad bya zhe na /
translated: What is it called?

original: 'gro ba 'dul ba zhe bya ste zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul ba zhe bya ste zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The fourth is called taming beings.

original: 'gro ba thams cad 'dis 'dul bas na ming 'gro ba 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad 'dis 'dul bas na ming 'gro ba 'dul ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called taming beings because all beings are tamed by it.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: gru bzhi ba la bzhi pa //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gru bzhi ba la bzhi pa // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The fourth is square.

original: thig bzhi btab pa'i thig ni drang bar bya'i phyir //
analyzed: thig bzhi btab pa'i thig ni drang bar bya'i phyir //
translated: The thread is drawn straight in order to set the four threads.

original: sgo dang mtshams rnams su thig gdab pa ste bya ba gzhan gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgo dang mtshams rnams su thig gdab pa ste bya ba gzhan gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: The thread is set in the doors and intermediate directions, not for any other purpose.🔽It is adorned with silk and garlands.

original: dar dang phreng bas brgyan pa dang // zhes bya ba la dar ni khru nyi shu rtsa nga ba'i tshad la zheng du khrug gang pa'i dar 'di ni dar zhes bshad de /
analyzed: dar dang phreng bas brgyan pa dang // zhes bya ba la dar ni khru nyi shu rtsa nga ba'i tshad la zheng du khrug gang pa'i dar 'di ni dar zhes bshad de /
translated: Silk is explained as silk twenty-five cubits long and one cubit wide.

original: de lta bu ser po dang sngon po dang dmar po dang / dkar po'i dar lce dag gis brgyan pa'o /
analyzed: de lta bu ser po dang sngon po dang dmar po dang / dkar po'i dar lce dag gis brgyan pa'o /
translated: It is adorned with such silk ribbons of yellow, blue, red, and white.

original: phreng ba ni me tog gi phreng ba dang / dar gyi phreng ba'o //
analyzed: phreng ba ni me tog gi phreng ba dang / dar gyi phreng ba'o //
translated: Garlands are flower garlands and silk garlands.

original: brgyan pa ni spud pa'o //
analyzed: brgyan pa ni spud pa'o //
translated: Adorned means ornamented.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi grva thams cad dang sgo khyud kyi nang gi mtshams su rdo rje dang rin po chen rnams kyis spras pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi grva thams cad dang sgo khyud kyi nang gi mtshams su rdo rje dang rin po chen rnams kyis spras pa'o //
translated: In all the corners of the maṇḍala and in the inner space of the door-jambs, it is adorned with vajras and jewels.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa'i dbyibs de dag brgyan pa'i tshul de ltar byas nas phyi'i dkyil 'khor thig gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa'i dbyibs de dag brgyan pa'i tshul de ltar byas nas phyi'i dkyil 'khor thig gdab par bya'o //
translated: Having made the adornments in the manner described, one should lay out the lines of the outer maṇḍala.

original: de lta bu'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor de'i nang du zhes bya ba ste nang rol du thig gru bzhir gdab par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyi'i dkyil 'khor de'i nang du zhes bya ba ste nang rol du thig gru bzhir gdab par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: “In the inner space of that kind of outer maṇḍala” means that one should lay out the lines of the square [inner maṇḍala] in the inner space.

original: de yang thig dang po dang gnyis pa ni gru bzhi pa nyid de de'i dbus su gdab bo //
analyzed: de yang thig dang po dang gnyis pa ni gru bzhi pa nyid de de'i dbus su gdab bo //
translated: Moreover, the first and second lines are square, and one should lay them out in the center.

original: gnyis pa de'i grva grang du gdod ce na /🔽grva ni sgor zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gnyis pa de'i grva grang du gdod ce na / grva ni sgor zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: If one asks, “Should one lay out the lines in the corners of the second [line]?”🔽[The Bhagavān] declares, “The corners are the doors.”

original: grva sgo la mngon par phyogs pa la ni grva ni sgor zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: grva sgo la mngon par phyogs pa la ni grva ni sgor zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The corners that face the doors are called “the corners.”

original: thig dang po'i grva sgo'i thad kar 'byung bas na grva'o //
analyzed: thig dang po'i grva sgo'i thad kar 'byung bas na grva'o //
translated: Since the corners occur in the direction of the doors of the first line, they are the corners.

original: de nas cir 'gyur zhe na /🔽padmo 'dab ma @32a * //
analyzed: de nas cir 'gyur zhe na / padmo 'dab ma @32a * //
translated: If one asks, “What happens then?”

original: brgyad par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: brgyad par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “There will be an eight-petaled lotus.”

original: ka ba brgyad kyi tshul du ni //
analyzed: ka ba brgyad kyi tshul du ni //
translated: In the manner of eight pillars,

original: padmo 'dab ma brgyad pa bri //
analyzed: padmo 'dab ma brgyad pa bri //
translated: one should draw an eight-petaled lotus.

original: zhes bya ba sgo re re'i thad kar yang ka ba gnyis gnyis te de'i 'dab mar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sgo re re'i thad kar yang ka ba gnyis gnyis te de'i 'dab mar bya'o //
translated: Thus, in front of each door there are two pillars, and one should make [the lotus] with those petals.

original: padma'i ge sar dbus su ni /
analyzed: padma'i ge sar dbus su ni /
translated: In the center of the lotus stamens,

original: zhes bya ba lte ba'i dbus su sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lte ba'i dbus su sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs gzhag par bya'o //
translated: in the center of the hub, one should place the image of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyogs bzhi po'i phyogs thams cad du rigs kyi phyag rgya bzhi bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi phyogs bzhi po'i phyogs thams cad du rigs kyi phyag rgya bzhi bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the four directions of the Blessed One, Buddha, one should draw the four clan seals.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What are they like?

original: padmo'i dbus su gnas pa yi //
analyzed: padmo'i dbus su gnas pa yi //
translated: In the center of the lotus,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //
translated: thus it is said.

original: ming ji skad du bya ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ming ji skad du bya ba zhig ce na /
translated: What are their names?

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Vajra and so forth are stated.

original: rin po che ni rin po che nyid do //
analyzed: rin po che ni rin po che nyid do //
translated: Jewel is just a jewel.

original: sna tshogs padmo zhes bya ba ni padmo ba bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs padmo zhes bya ba ni padmo ba bzhi pa'o //
translated: Multicolored lotus is a four-colored lotus.

original: rdo rje shugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: rdo rje shugs kyis zhes bya ba'i don ni bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of with vajra speed has been explained.

original: der ni spyan ras gzigs dbang bri //
analyzed: der ni spyan ras gzigs dbang bri //
translated: There, one should draw Avalokiteśvara.

original: gzugs rnams thams cad 'byin pa ste //
analyzed: gzugs rnams thams cad 'byin pa ste //
translated: All forms are emitted.

original: zhes ya ba ni ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten pas 'das pa'i lha'i gzugs rnams 'byung bar bya'o ;
analyzed: zhes ya ba ni ba spu'i bu ga thams cad nas 'jig rten dang 'jig rten pas 'das pa'i lha'i gzugs rnams 'byung bar bya'o ;
translated: Thus, from all the pores of the body, one should emit the forms of worldly and transcendent deities.

original: / rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su ni sangs rgyas kyi sku rdo rje 'gying ba'i sbyor bas bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: / rdo rje sems dpa'i gnas su ni sangs rgyas kyi sku rdo rje 'gying ba'i sbyor bas bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: In the place of Vajrasattva, one should remain in the posture of the proud Buddha Vajra Body.

original: rdo rje rgyal po'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug bzhi pa rdo rje rgyal po'i gzugs can te /
analyzed: rdo rje rgyal po'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug bzhi pa rdo rje rgyal po'i gzugs can te /
translated: In the place of Vajrarāja, one should assume the form of the fourth, Vajrarāja, the Lord of the World.

original: phyag g-yas pa gnyis na rdo rje dang ral gri /
analyzed: phyag g-yas pa gnyis na rdo rje dang ral gri /
translated: In the two right hands one should hold a vajra and a sword,

original: phyag g-yon pa gnyis nang padma dang lcags khyu bsnams par bya'o //🔽rdo rje chags pa'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug rdo rje chags pa'i gzugs su bya'o //
analyzed: phyag g-yon pa gnyis nang padma dang lcags khyu bsnams par bya'o // rdo rje chags pa'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug rdo rje chags pa'i gzugs su bya'o //
translated: and in the two left hands a lotus and a lasso.🔽In the place of Vajrarāga, one should assume the form of Vajrarāga, the Lord of the World.

original: rdo rje legs pa'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug rdo rje legs pa'i gzugs su bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje legs pa'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug rdo rje legs pa'i gzugs su bya'o //
translated: In the place of Vajrasādhu, one should assume the form of Vajrasādhu, the Lord of the World.

original: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i dbus su 'jig rten dbang phyug ral pa dang / thor tshugs su ldan pa bris la de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das 'dod dpag tu med pa ral pa dang thor tshugs kyi phug na bzhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis pa'i dbus su 'jig rten dbang phyug ral pa dang / thor tshugs su ldan pa bris la de'i dbus su bcom ldan 'das 'dod dpag tu med pa ral pa dang thor tshugs kyi phug na bzhugs par bya'o //
translated: In the center of the second mandala, draw Avalokiteśvara with matted hair and a topknot. In the center of that, draw the Blessed One, Amitābha, dwelling in the cave of matted hair and a topknot.

original: rdo rje rin chen gyi gnas su padmo'i khro gnyer gyi gzugs bris la /
analyzed: rdo rje rin chen gyi gnas su padmo'i khro gnyer gyi gzugs bris la /
translated: In the place of Vajraratna, draw the form of Padmakuṇḍalin.

original: phyag gcig pa la ni padma bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag gcig pa la ni padma bsnams pa /
translated: In the one-handed [form], he holds a lotus.

original: gzhan rnams la ni bgrang phreng dang / dbyig pa dang / gun dhe thogs pa bri'o ;🔽/ rdo rje gzi brjid kyi gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug nyi ma'i gzugs can du bri'o //🔽rdo rje dpal gyi gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug zla ba'i gzugs can padma'i nor bu'i rgyal mtshan bsnams pa zi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams la ni bgrang phreng dang / dbyig pa dang / gun dhe thogs pa bri'o ; / rdo rje gzi brjid kyi gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug nyi ma'i gzugs can du bri'o // rdo rje dpal gyi gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug zla ba'i gzugs can padma'i nor bu'i rgyal mtshan bsnams pa zi bar bya'o //
translated: In the others, he holds a rosary, a club, and a guṇḍi.🔽In the place of Vajratejas, draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of the sun.🔽In the place of Vajyaśas, draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of the moon, holding a lotus jewel banner.

original: rdo rje bzhad pa'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug zhal bcu gcig pa ste /
analyzed: rdo rje bzhad pa'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug zhal bcu gcig pa ste /
translated: In the place of Vajrahasita, draw Avalokiteśvara with eleven faces.

original: go @32b rims ni lnga dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig tu bya'o //
analyzed: go @32b rims ni lnga dang gsum dang gnyis dang gcig tu bya'o //
translated: The order is five, three, two, and one.

original: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gsum pa'i dbus su 'jig rten dbang phyug snyoms bar zhugs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dkyil 'khor gsum pa'i dbus su 'jig rten dbang phyug snyoms bar zhugs par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, in the center of the third maṇḍala, one should draw Avalokiteśvara in union.

original: 'jig rten dbang gi gnas su ni sgrol ma padma'i phyag rgyal rtogs par bri'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dbang gi gnas su ni sgrol ma padma'i phyag rgyal rtogs par bri'o //
translated: In the place of Avalokiteśvara, one should draw Tārā with a lotus gesture.

original: rdo rje rnon bo'i gnas su ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gzhon nu gdong drug pa'i gzugs can padma dang mdung dang / ral gri thogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje rnon bo'i gnas su ni 'jig rten dbang phyug gzhon nu gdong drug pa'i gzugs can padma dang mdung dang / ral gri thogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the place of Vajra-Tikshna, one should draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of Kumāra with six faces, holding a lotus, spear, and sword.

original: rdo rje rgyu'i gnas su ni 'jig rten dbang phyug bde byed khyab 'jug gi gzugs can phyag bzhi pa g-yas gnyis na 'khor lo dang dbyig pa thogs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje rgyu'i gnas su ni 'jig rten dbang phyug bde byed khyab 'jug gi gzugs can phyag bzhi pa g-yas gnyis na 'khor lo dang dbyig pa thogs pa /
translated: In the place of Vajra-Hetu, one should draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of Viṣṇu, four-armed, holding a wheel and mace with the two right hands,

original: g-yon gnyis na padma dang mdung thogs pa'i bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon gnyis na padma dang mdung thogs pa'i bri bar bya'o //
translated: and a lotus and spear with the two left hands.

original: rdo rje smra pa'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug rdo rje tshangs pa'i gzugs can du bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje smra pa'i gnas su 'jig rten dbang phyug rdo rje tshangs pa'i gzugs can du bya'o //
translated: In the place of Vajra-Vāca, one should draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of Brahmā with a vajra.

original: dkyil 'khor bzhin 'khor bzhi gdon mi za bar grub pa'i gnas sdug der ni padma zhal bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug zhal bzhi par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhin 'khor bzhi gdon mi za bar grub pa'i gnas sdug der ni padma zhal bzhi pa zhes bya ba'i spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug zhal bzhi par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In that place, which is certainly the abode of the fourfold mandala, one should draw the four-faced Avalokiteśvara called Padma-vaktra.

original: phyag g-yas na mdung bsnams pa /
analyzed: phyag g-yas na mdung bsnams pa /
translated: In his right hand he holds a spear,

original: g-yon pa padma bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: g-yon pa padma bsnams pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: and in his left a lotus.

original: rdo rjes las kyi gnas su ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gar gyi dbang phyug gi gzugs su bri bar bya'o //🔽rdo rje bsrung ba'i gnas su ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rdo rje bsrung ba'i gzugs su bri bar bya'o /🔽rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gnas su spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gzugs su bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rjes las kyi gnas su ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gar gyi dbang phyug gi gzugs su bri bar bya'o // rdo rje bsrung ba'i gnas su ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rdo rje bsrung ba'i gzugs su bri bar bya'o / rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gnas su spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rdo rje gnod sbyin gyi gzugs su bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the place of Vajra-karma one should draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of Nāṭyeśvara,🔽in the place of Vajra-rakṣa one should draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of Vajra-rakṣa,🔽in the place of Vajra-yakṣa one should draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of Vajra-yakṣa,

original: rdo rje khu tshur gyi gnas su ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rdo rje khu tshur 'chad ba bri par bya'o /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gyi gnas su ni spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug rdo rje khu tshur 'chad ba bri par bya'o /
translated: and in the place of Vajra-muṣṭi one should draw Avalokiteśvara in the form of Vajra-muṣṭi.

original: phyi dang nang gi grva rnams su rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams rang gi phyag rgya padma mtshan pa thogs pa bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi grva rnams su rdo rje sgeg mo la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams rang gi phyag rgya padma mtshan pa thogs pa bri bar bya'o //
translated: In the inner and outer corners, one should draw the goddesses such as Vajra Lāsya holding their respective emblems marked with lotuses.

original: de nas sgo bzhi po rnams su sgo srung bzhi bri bar bya /
analyzed: de nas sgo bzhi po rnams su sgo srung bzhi bri bar bya /
translated: Then, in the four doors, one should draw the four door-guardians.

original: de la 'jug pa'i sgor ni bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug rta mgrin gyi gzugs su bri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug pa'i sgor ni bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten dbang phyug rta mgrin gyi gzugs su bri bar bya'o //
translated: At the entrance door, one should draw the Blessed One Avalokiteśvara in the form of Hayagrīva.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is he like?
